notes_zh: 这是整部要理问答的基础。我们被造不是为了自己的快乐，而是为了荣耀神。真正的喜乐来自认识神、享受神。
question_zh: 问1：人最主要、最崇高的目的是什么？
question_en: What is the chief and highest end of man?
answer_en: Man's chief and highest end is to glorify God, and fully to enjoy him forever.
answer_zh: 答：人最主要、最崇高的目的就是（一）荣耀神1，（二）完全以祂为乐，直到永远2。
notes_en: This foundational question establishes that humanity's purpose is God-centered. True joy and fulfillment come not from self-pursuit but from glorifying and enjoying God forever.
question: What is the chief and highest end of man?
answer: Man's chief and highest end is to glorify God, and fully to enjoy him forever.

notes_zh: 自然界展现了神的存在，但仅凭自然启示不足以使人得救。我们需要圣经的特殊启示和圣灵的光照，才能真正认识神。
question_zh: 问2：如何证明神的存在？
question_en: How doth it appear that there is a God?
answer_en: The very light of nature in man, and the works of God, declare plainly that there is a God; but his word and Spirit only do sufficiently and effectually reveal him unto men for their salvation.
answer_zh: 答：人心中的天然之光（light of nature）和神的作为，都在宣告神的存在1；但是，惟独神的道和圣灵才能充分地、有效地把祂自己启示给人2，使人因而得救。
notes_en: General revelation in nature demonstrates God's existence, but special revelation through Scripture and the Spirit is necessary for saving knowledge of God.
question: How doth it appear that there is a God?
answer: The very light of nature in man, and the works of God, declare plainly that there is a God; but his word and Spirit only do sufficiently and effectually reveal him unto men for their salvation.

notes_zh: 圣经是我们信仰和行为的唯一权威标准。旧约和新约共同构成神完整的话语，指引我们认识神并顺服祂。
question_zh: 问3：神的道是什么？
question_en: What is the Word of God?
answer_en: The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testament are the Word of God, the only rule of faith and obedience.
answer_zh: 答：新旧约圣经就是神的道1，是信仰与顺服的惟一准则2。
notes_en: Scripture alone is the authoritative rule for what we believe and how we live. Both Old and New Testaments together form the complete Word of God.
question: What is the Word of God?
answer: The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testament are the Word of God, the only rule of faith and obedience.

notes_zh: 圣经的权威有外在证据（一致性、纯洁性等）和内在见证（圣灵在人心中的确认）。最终使我们确信圣经是神话语的，是圣灵的工作。
question_zh: 问4：如何证明圣经就是神的道？
question_en: How doth it appear that the Scriptures are the Word of God?
answer_en: The Scriptures manifest themselves to be the Word of God, by their majesty and purity; by the consent of all the parts, and the scope of the whole, which is to give all glory to God; by their light and power to convince and convert sinners, to comfort and build up believers unto salvation: but the Spirit of God bearing witness by and with the Scriptures in the heart of man, is alone able fully to persuade it that they are the very Word of God.
answer_zh: 答：许多方面都足以证明圣经（Scripture）是神的道：（一）圣经文体的庄严1，教理的纯正2，各部的协和3，范围的全备（将一切的荣耀都归给神）4；（二）圣经的亮光和权能可以使罪人知罪、归正，使信徒得安慰、得造就，以致最终能以得救5。（三）但是，惟独神的灵，「借着并伴随着」圣经在人心中的见证，才能完全使人信服圣经确实是神的话6。
notes_en: The authority of Scripture rests on both external evidences (consistency, purity, majesty) and the internal testimony of the Holy Spirit. Ultimately, it is the Spirit who convinces our hearts.
question: How doth it appear that the Scriptures are the Word of God?
answer: The Scriptures manifest themselves to be the Word of God, by their majesty and purity; by the consent of all the parts, and the scope of the whole, which is to give all glory to God; by their light and power to convince and convert sinners, to comfort and build up believers unto salvation: but the Spirit of God bearing witness by and with the Scriptures in the heart of man, is alone able fully to persuade it that they are the very Word of God.

notes_zh: 圣经的内容可以归纳为两大部分：教义（当信的）和实践（当行的）。这也是要理问答的基本结构。
question_zh: 问5：圣经主要教导的是什么？
question_en: What do the Scriptures principally teach?
answer_en: The Scriptures principally teach what man is to believe concerning God, and what duty God requires of man. WHAT MAN OUGHT TO BELIEVE CONCERNING GOD
answer_zh: 答：圣经主要教导的是：（一）人对于神所当信的真理，（二）神要人所当尽的本分1。
notes_en: Scripture's teaching can be summarized in two categories: doctrine (what to believe) and duty (how to live). This also shapes the structure of the catechism.
question: What do the Scriptures principally teach?
answer: The Scriptures principally teach what man is to believe concerning God, and what duty God requires of man. WHAT MAN OUGHT TO BELIEVE CONCERNING GOD

notes_zh: 圣经启示了神的本性、三位一体的真理、以及每一位格的独特属性和工作。认识神是信仰的根基。
question_zh: 问6：圣经可以使我们明白哪些有关神的真理？
question_en: What do the Scriptures make known of God?
answer_en: The Scriptures make known what God is, the persons in the Godhead, his decrees, and the execution of his decrees.
answer_zh: 答：圣经可以使我们明白：（一）神是怎样的一位神1，（二）神的位格2、神的元旨（decrees of God）3， （三）神如何执行祂的元旨4。
notes_en: Scripture reveals God's nature, the Trinity, and the distinct properties and works of each divine person. Knowing God is the foundation of faith.
question: What do the Scriptures make known of God?
answer: The Scriptures make known what God is, the persons in the Godhead, his decrees, and the execution of his decrees.

notes_zh: 这个回答概括了神的属性：祂是灵，是自有永有的，拥有一切完美。神不受任何限制，祂是一切美善的源头。
question_zh: 问7：神是怎样的一位神？
question_en: What is God?
answer_en: God is a Spirit, in and of himself infinite in being, glory, blessedness, and perfection; all-sufficient, eternal, unchangeable, incomprehensible, everywhere present, almighty, knowing all things, most wise, most holy, most just, most merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth.
answer_zh: 答：（一）神是个灵1，祂的存有2、荣耀3、福祉4和完全5，都是无限无量的；（二）祂是全然充足6、永恒7、不会改变8、无法测度9、无所不在10、无所不能11 的；（三）祂知道万有12，极其智慧13、极其圣洁14、极其公义15、极其怜悯、恒久忍耐又有丰盛的恩慈和信实16。
notes_en: This answer summarizes God's attributes: He is spirit, self-existent, and possesses all perfections. God is unlimited and the source of all goodness.
question: What is God?
answer: God is a Spirit, in and of himself infinite in being, glory, blessedness, and perfection; all-sufficient, eternal, unchangeable, incomprehensible, everywhere present, almighty, knowing all things, most wise, most holy, most just, most merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth.

notes_zh: 一神论是基督教信仰的核心。虽然神是三位一体的，但只有一位神。这把基督教与多神教区分开来。
question_zh: 问8：神是独一的吗？
question_en: Are there more Gods than one?
answer_en: There is but one only, the living and true God.
answer_zh: 答：神是独一无二、又真又活的1。
notes_en: Monotheism is central to Christian faith. Though God is triune, there is only one God. This distinguishes Christianity from polytheism.
question: Are there more Gods than one?
answer: There is but one only, the living and true God.

notes_zh: 三位一体是基督教最核心的教义之一。三个位格在本质上完全相同，但在位格关系和工作分工上有所不同。
question_zh: 问9：神有几个位格？
question_en: How many persons are there in the Godhead?
answer_en: There be three persons in the Godhead, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost; and these three are one true, eternal God, the same in substance, equal in power and glory; although distinguished by their personal properties.
answer_zh: 答：神有三个位格：圣父，圣子，圣灵；但这三个位格是同一信实、永恒的神，只有一个本质，权能相同、荣耀相等；但各有不同的特性1。
notes_en: The Trinity is one of Christianity's most essential doctrines. The three persons are identical in essence but distinguished in their personal relations and works.
question: How many persons are there in the Godhead?
answer: There be three persons in the Godhead, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost; and these three are one true, eternal God, the same in substance, equal in power and glory; although distinguished by their personal properties.

notes_zh: 三位一体的位格关系是永恒的：父生子，灵从父和子而出。这不是时间中的事件，而是永恒的关系。
question_zh: 问10：神的这三个位格各有什么特性？
question_en: What are the personal properties of the three persons in the Godhead?
answer_en: It is proper to the Father to beget the Son, and to the Son to be begotten of the Father, and to the Holy Ghost to proceed from the Father and the Son from all eternity.
answer_zh: 答：圣父生圣子1，圣子由圣父而生2，圣灵由圣父和圣子自永恒发出3。
notes_en: The personal relations within the Trinity are eternal: the Father begets the Son, and the Spirit proceeds from Father and Son. These are not temporal events but eternal relations.
question: What are the personal properties of the three persons in the Godhead?
answer: It is proper to the Father to beget the Son, and to the Son to be begotten of the Father, and to the Holy Ghost to proceed from the Father and the Son from all eternity.

notes_zh: 圣经将只属于神的名称、属性和敬拜归给圣子和圣灵，这证明祂们的完全神性和与父的平等。
question_zh: 问11：如何证明圣子、圣灵与圣父同为神？
question_en: How doth it appear that the Son and the Holy Ghost are God equal with the Father?
answer_en: The Scriptures manifest that the Son and the Holy Ghost are God equal with the Father, ascribing unto them such names, attributes, works, and worship, as are proper to God only.
answer_zh: 答：圣经把惟独属于神的名字1、属性2、作为3和敬拜4，也归于圣子和圣灵，证明祂们与圣父同为神。
notes_en: Scripture ascribes divine names, attributes, and worship to both the Son and the Spirit, proving their full deity and equality with the Father.
question: How doth it appear that the Son and the Holy Ghost are God equal with the Father?
answer: The Scriptures manifest that the Son and the Holy Ghost are God equal with the Father, ascribing unto them such names, attributes, works, and worship, as are proper to God only.

notes_zh: 神的旨意是永恒的、不变的、智慧的。一切发生的事都在神的计划之中，而这一切都是为了彰显祂的荣耀。
question_zh: 问12：神的元旨是什么？
question_en: What are the decrees of God?
answer_en: God's decrees are the wise, free, and holy acts of the counsel of his will, whereby, from all eternity, he hath, for his own glory, unchangeably foreordained whatsoever comes to pass in time, especially concerning angels and men.
answer_zh: 答：神的元旨 是祂旨意中那智慧的、自由的、圣洁的行动计划1；也就是：为了祂自己的荣耀，神在永恒里毫无变更地预定了历史中要发生的一切事2，特别是有关于天使和人类的事。
notes_en: God's decrees are eternal, unchangeable, and wise. Everything that comes to pass is within God's sovereign plan, all for the display of His glory.
question: What are the decrees of God?
answer: God's decrees are the wise, free, and holy acts of the counsel of his will, whereby, from all eternity, he hath, for his own glory, unchangeably foreordained whatsoever comes to pass in time, especially concerning angels and men.

notes_zh: 这是预定论的教义。神在永恒中拣选了一些人得救，也任凭其余的人在罪中灭亡。这彰显了神的恩典和公义。
question_zh: 问13：关于天使和人类，神预定了哪些特别的元旨？
question_en: What hath God especially decreed concerning angels and men?
answer_en: God, by an eternal and immutable decree, out of his mere love, for the praise of his glorious grace, to be manifested in due time, hath elected some angels to glory; and in Christ hath chosen some men to eternal life, and the means thereof: and also, according to his sovereign power, and the unsearchable counsel of his own will (whereby he extendeth or withholdeth favor as he pleaseth), hath passed by and foreordained the rest to dishonor and wrath, to be for their sin inflicted, to the praise of the glory of his justice.
answer_zh: 答：（一）神出于自己的美意，在日期满足的时候，就借着祂永恒的、不变的元旨，拣选了一部分的天使得荣耀1；（二）又在基督里，拣选了一部分人得永生，并且也预定了得永生的方式，使祂荣耀的恩典得着称讚2。（三）此外，神按着祂至高的主权和不可测度的旨意（祂随己意施与或收回恩典），置其馀的人于不顾，预定他们受羞辱和震怒，为他们自身的罪而受苦，使祂荣耀的公义得着称讚3。
notes_en: This is the doctrine of predestination. God eternally elected some to salvation and passed by the rest. This displays both His grace and His justice.
question: What hath God especially decreed concerning angels and men?
answer: God, by an eternal and immutable decree, out of his mere love, for the praise of his glorious grace, to be manifested in due time, hath elected some angels to glory; and in Christ hath chosen some men to eternal life, and the means thereof: and also, according to his sovereign power, and the unsearchable counsel of his own will (whereby he extendeth or withholdeth favor as he pleaseth), hath passed by and foreordained the rest to dishonor and wrath, to be for their sin inflicted, to the praise of the glory of his justice.

notes_zh: 神不仅计划了一切，也通过创造和护理来实现祂的旨意。创造是起初的工作，护理是持续的工作。
question_zh: 问14：神怎样执行祂的元旨？
question_en: How doth God execute his decrees?
answer_en: God executeth his decrees in the works of creation and providence, according to his infallible foreknowledge, and the free and immutable counsel of his own will.
answer_zh: 答：神根据祂无谬的预知，根据祂旨意中自由、不变的计划，在创造和护理之工中，执行祂的元旨1。
notes_en: God not only planned all things but carries them out through creation and providence. Creation is the initial work; providence is His ongoing governance.
question: How doth God execute his decrees?
answer: God executeth his decrees in the works of creation and providence, according to his infallible foreknowledge, and the free and immutable counsel of his own will.

notes_zh: 神从无中创造万有，彰显了祂无限的能力。一切受造之物都为神的荣耀而存在。
question_zh: 问15：创造之工是什么？
question_en: What is the work of creation?
answer_en: The work of creation is that wherein God did in the beginning, by the word of his power, make of nothing the world, and all things therein, for himself, within the space of six days, and all very good.
answer_zh: 答：创造之工就是：在起初的时候，神用祂权能的道，在六日之内，为祂自己从无有中创造了世界并其中的万物，并且所造的都甚好1。
notes_en: God created everything from nothing, displaying His infinite power. All creation exists for God's glory.
question: What is the work of creation?
answer: The work of creation is that wherein God did in the beginning, by the word of his power, make of nothing the world, and all things therein, for himself, within the space of six days, and all very good.

notes_zh: 天使是受造的灵体，有能力和智慧，但他们并非不可改变——有些天使堕落了。这提醒我们只有神是不变的。
question_zh: 问16：神怎样造天使？
question_en: How did God create angels?
answer_en: God created all the angels spirits, immortal, holy, excelling in knowledge, mighty in power, to execute his commandments, and to praise his name, yet subject to change.
answer_zh: 答：神创造了一切的天使1，是属灵的2、不灭的（immortal）3、圣洁的4，这些天使大有知识5、大有权能6地来执行神的命令，并称颂祂的圣名7；但天使是会改变的8。
notes_en: Angels are created spiritual beings with power and knowledge, but they are mutable — some fell. This reminds us that only God is unchangeable.
question: How did God create angels?
answer: God created all the angels spirits, immortal, holy, excelling in knowledge, mighty in power, to execute his commandments, and to praise his name, yet subject to change.

notes_zh: 人是按神的形象造的，这赋予了人独特的尊严。起初人有知识、公义和圣洁，但也有堕落的可能。
question_zh: 问17：神怎样造人？
question_en: How did God create man?
answer_en: After God had made all other creatures, he created man male and female; formed the body of the man of the dust of the ground, and the woman of the rib of the man, endued them with living, reasonable, and immortal souls; made them after his own image, in knowledge, righteousness, and holiness; having the law of God written in their hearts, and power to fulfill it, and dominion over the creatures; yet subject to fall.
answer_zh: 答：神创造了其他各样受造物之后，就造男造女1；用地上的尘土造了男人的身体2，再用男人的肋骨造了女人的身体3，赋予他们活泼的、理性的、不灭的（immortal）灵魂4；祂按着自己的形像造了他们5，有知识6、仁义和圣洁7；又把神的律法刻在他们的心中8，赐给他们遵行的力量9，也使他们能够治理万物10；但人是有可能堕落的11。
notes_en: Humans are made in God's image, giving them unique dignity. Originally created with knowledge, righteousness, and holiness, yet with the possibility of falling.
question: How did God create man?
answer: After God had made all other creatures, he created man male and female; formed the body of the man of the dust of the ground, and the woman of the rib of the man, endued them with living, reasonable, and immortal souls; made them after his own image, in knowledge, righteousness, and holiness; having the law of God written in their hearts, and power to fulfill it, and dominion over the creatures; yet subject to fall.

notes_zh: 护理是神持续不断地看顾和管理万有的工作。没有任何事情在神的掌管之外，这给信徒带来极大的安慰。
question_zh: 问18：神的护理之工是什么？
question_en: What are God's works of providence?
answer_en: God's works of providence are his most holy, wise, and powerful preserving and governing all his creatures; ordering them, and all their actions, to his own glory.
answer_zh: 答：神的护理之工是：（一）祂极其圣洁地1、智慧地2、有权能地保守3 、治理4 祂所创造的万有；（二）祂也调度万有和他们所有的行动5，使祂自己得荣耀6。
notes_en: Providence is God's continuous care and governance of all things. Nothing falls outside His sovereign control, which brings great comfort to believers.
question: What are God's works of providence?
answer: God's works of providence are his most holy, wise, and powerful preserving and governing all his creatures; ordering them, and all their actions, to his own glory.

notes_zh: 堕落天使的命运提醒我们罪的严重性。蒙保守的天使服事神的旨意，也服事信徒。这都在神的主权计划中。
question_zh: 问19：神对天使有什么特别的护理？
question_en: What is God's providence towards the angels?
answer_en: God by his providence permitted some of the angels, willfully and irrecoverably, to fall into sin and damnation, limiting and ordering that, and all their sins, to his own glory; and established the rest in holiness and happiness; employing them all, at his pleasure, in the administrations of his power, mercy, and justice.
answer_zh: 答：（一）借着祂的护理，神容许某些天使，故意地、不可挽回地堕落在罪恶和毁灭之中1，并且限制、掌管他们所有的罪2，好使祂自己得着荣耀；（二）其馀的天使在圣洁和喜乐之中得以坚固3，随祂自己的美意使用他们4，来施行祂的权柄、怜悯和公义5。
notes_en: The fate of fallen angels reminds us of sin's gravity. Elect angels serve God's purposes and minister to believers. All is within God's sovereign plan.
question: What is God's providence towards the angels?
answer: God by his providence permitted some of the angels, willfully and irrecoverably, to fall into sin and damnation, limiting and ordering that, and all their sins, to his own glory; and established the rest in holiness and happiness; employing them all, at his pleasure, in the administrations of his power, mercy, and justice.

notes_zh: 神与亚当所立的行为之约，要求完全的顺服，应许生命为奖赏，以死亡为违约的刑罚。这为理解福音奠定了基础。
question_zh: 问20：神造人的时候，对人有什么特别的护理？
question_en: What was the providence of God toward man in the estate in which he was created?
answer_en: The providence of God toward man in the estate in which he was created, was the placing him in paradise, appointing him to dress it, giving him liberty to eat of the fruit of the earth; putting the creatures under his dominion, and ordaining marriage for his help; affording him communion with himself; instituting the Sabbath; entering into a covenant of life with him, upon condition of personal, perfect, and perpetual obedience, of which the tree of life was a pledge; and forbidding to eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, upon the pain of death.
answer_zh: 答：神对起初受造之人的护理是：把他安置在伊甸园（paradise）里，吩咐他修理看守这个园子，赐给他吃地上各样果子的自由1，将万物置于他的治理之下2，设立婚姻帮助他3，提供他与神自己亲密的交通4，设立安息日5。又与他立生命之约（covenant of life）──以个人的、完全的、持续的顺服为条件6，生命树就是这生命之约的记号7，人不可吃分别善恶树的果子，否则必受死亡的苦楚8。
notes_en: The covenant of works with Adam required perfect obedience, promised life as reward, and death as penalty. This foundational covenant sets the stage for understanding the gospel.
question: What was the providence of God toward man in the estate in which he was created?
answer: The providence of God toward man in the estate in which he was created, was the placing him in paradise, appointing him to dress it, giving him liberty to eat of the fruit of the earth; putting the creatures under his dominion, and ordaining marriage for his help; affording him communion with himself; instituting the Sabbath; entering into a covenant of life with him, upon condition of personal, perfect, and perpetual obedience, of which the tree of life was a pledge; and forbidding to eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, upon the pain of death.

notes_zh: 亚当和夏娃自由选择了悖逆神。堕落不是神强迫的，而是人在试探中的自愿行为。这改变了整个人类的命运。
question_zh: 问21：人守住了起初受造的地位吗？
question_en: Did man continue in that estate wherein God at first created him?
answer_en: Our first parents being left to the freedom of their own will, through the temptation of Satan, transgressed the commandment of God in eating the forbidden fruit; and thereby fell from the estate of innocency wherein they were created.
answer_zh: 答：我们的始祖既有自由意志，就因着撒但的诱惑而吃了禁果，违背了神的诫命；因而从起初受造的无罪光景中堕落了1。
notes_en: Adam and Eve freely chose to disobey God. The Fall was not coerced but voluntary, and it changed the destiny of all humanity.
question: Did man continue in that estate wherein God at first created him?
answer: Our first parents being left to the freedom of their own will, through the temptation of Satan, transgressed the commandment of God in eating the forbidden fruit; and thereby fell from the estate of innocency wherein they were created.

notes_zh: 亚当是全人类的代表。他的罪和堕落归算给了所有人。这就是原罪的教义，解释了为什么每个人生来就是罪人。
question_zh: 问22：全人类都在亚当的首次犯罪中堕落了吗？
question_en: Did all mankind fall in that first transgression?
answer_en: The covenant being made with Adam as a public person, not for himself only, but for his posterity, all mankind descending from him by ordinary generation, sinned in him, and fell with him in that first transgression.
answer_zh: 答：神与亚当立约，亚当是作为众人的代表——不仅是为他自己，也是为他的后裔；所以凡从亚当按常例而生的全人类1，就都在他里面犯了罪，也在他首次的犯罪中与他一同堕落了2。
notes_en: Adam acted as the representative head of all humanity. His sin is imputed to all people. This doctrine of original sin explains why everyone is born sinful.
question: Did all mankind fall in that first transgression?
answer: The covenant being made with Adam as a public person, not for himself only, but for his posterity, all mankind descending from him by ordinary generation, sinned in him, and fell with him in that first transgression.

notes_zh: 堕落的后果是双重的：罪（与神隔绝、本性败坏）和苦（受苦、死亡的现实）。这两者紧密相连。
question_zh: 问23：堕落使人类陷于怎样的境况中？
question_en: Into what estate did the fall bring mankind?
answer_en: The fall brought mankind into an estate of sin and misery.
answer_zh: 答：堕落使人陷于罪恶和苦境（misery）中1。
notes_en: The Fall's consequences are twofold: sin (separation from God, corrupt nature) and misery (suffering, death). These are inseparably connected.
question: Into what estate did the fall bring mankind?
answer: The fall brought mankind into an estate of sin and misery.

notes_zh: 罪不只是做了坏事（违犯），也包括没做该做的事（不遵行）。罪的标准是神的律法，不是人的标准。
question_zh: 问24：罪是什么？
question_en: What is sin?
answer_en: Sin is any want of conformity unto, or transgression of, any law of God, given as a rule to the reasonable creature.
answer_zh: 答：罪就是不遵行或违背神的一切律法。神赐下律法，是要作为有理性之受造者的准则1。
notes_en: Sin includes both commission (transgression) and omission (want of conformity). The standard is God's law, not human opinion.
question: What is sin?
answer: Sin is any want of conformity unto, or transgression of, any law of God, given as a rule to the reasonable creature.

notes_zh: 原罪包含三个方面：亚当之罪的罪咎归算给我们、原来公义的丧失、本性的全然败坏。一切实际的罪行都是从原罪流出的。
question_zh: 问25：人堕落后，陷在怎样的罪恶境况中？
question_en: Wherein consisteth the sinfulness of that estate whereinto man fell?
answer_en: The sinfulness of that estate whereinto man fell, consisteth in the guilt of Adam's first sin, the want of that righteousness wherein he was created, and the corruption of his nature, whereby he is utterly indisposed, disabled, and made opposite unto all that is spiritually good, and wholly inclined to all evil, and that continually; which is commonly called original sin, and from which do proceed all actual transgressions.
answer_zh: 答：人堕落后，所陷的罪恶境况是：（一）承担亚当首次犯罪所负的罪债1，丧失了受造时原有的仁义，并且整个人性也都败坏了；（二）因此对一切属灵的善彻底嫌恶、无能为力，甚至加以抵挡，又一心倾向各样邪恶，并持续如此2；这就是所谓的原罪（original sin），并由此生发各样的本罪（actual sin）3。
notes_en: Original sin involves three aspects: imputed guilt of Adam's sin, loss of original righteousness, and total corruption of nature. All actual sins flow from this original corruption.
question: Wherein consisteth the sinfulness of that estate whereinto man fell?
answer: The sinfulness of that estate whereinto man fell, consisteth in the guilt of Adam's first sin, the want of that righteousness wherein he was created, and the corruption of his nature, whereby he is utterly indisposed, disabled, and made opposite unto all that is spiritually good, and wholly inclined to all evil, and that continually; which is commonly called original sin, and from which do proceed all actual transgressions.

notes_zh: 原罪不是后天学来的，而是与生俱来的。每个人从受孕的那一刻起就带有罪性。这不是因为身体本身有罪，而是因为亚当的代表关系。
question_zh: 问26：原罪是如何从我们的始祖传给他们的后裔？
question_en: How is original sin conveyed from our first parents unto their posterity?
answer_en: Original sin is conveyed from our first parents unto their posterity by natural generation, so as all that proceed from them in that way are conceived and born in sin.
answer_zh: 答：借着自然的生育；因此，所有以此方式从他们而出的人，都是在罪中受孕、出生的1。
notes_en: Original sin is not learned but inherited from conception. This comes through Adam's representative headship, not because the physical body is inherently evil.
question: How is original sin conveyed from our first parents unto their posterity?
answer: Original sin is conveyed from our first parents unto their posterity by natural generation, so as all that proceed from them in that way are conceived and born in sin.

notes_zh: 堕落的后果极其严重：失去与神的关系、落在神的愤怒之下、受撒但的辖制、今生的苦难和永恒的刑罚。
question_zh: 问27：人堕落后，陷在怎样的苦境中？
question_en: What misery did the fall bring upon mankind?
answer_en: The fall brought upon mankind the loss of communion with God, his displeasure and curse; so as we are by nature children of wrath, bond slaves to Satan, and justly liable to all punishments in this world, and that which is to come.
answer_zh: 答：堕落使人类丧失了与神的交通1，招致祂的不悦和咒诅；因此，我们生来就是可怒之子2、撒但的奴仆3，当受今世和来世的一切刑罚4。
notes_en: The Fall's consequences are severe: loss of fellowship with God, subjection to His wrath, bondage to Satan, and liability to temporal and eternal punishment.
question: What misery did the fall bring upon mankind?
answer: The fall brought upon mankind the loss of communion with God, his displeasure and curse; so as we are by nature children of wrath, bond slaves to Satan, and justly liable to all punishments in this world, and that which is to come.

notes_zh: 罪的刑罚分为内在的（心灵的刚硬、良心的痛苦等）和外在的（身体的苦难、死亡等）。这些都是神公义审判的结果。
question_zh: 问28：因着罪，我们在今世要承受怎样的刑罚？
question_en: What are the punishments of sin in this world?
answer_en: The punishments of sin in this world are either inward, as blindness of mind, a reprobate sense, strong delusions, hardness of heart, horror of conscience, and vile affections; or outward, as the curse of God upon the creatures for our sakes, and all other evils that befall us in our bodies, names, estates, relations, and employments; together with death itself.
answer_zh: 答：罪在今世的刑罚有：内在的，例如理智被蒙蔽1，心里刚硬 2， 良心恐惧3，被神弃绝，以致邪僻 4，被大大蒙蔽5，卑贱的情慾6。外在的，例如因着我们的缘故，世界受了神的咒诅7；各样的邪恶也临到我们的身体、名誉、财产、人际关系和职业8，还有就是死亡9。
notes_en: Sin's punishments are both internal (spiritual blindness, hardened conscience) and external (physical suffering, death). These result from God's just judgment.
question: What are the punishments of sin in this world?
answer: The punishments of sin in this world are either inward, as blindness of mind, a reprobate sense, strong delusions, hardness of heart, horror of conscience, and vile affections; or outward, as the curse of God upon the creatures for our sakes, and all other evils that befall us in our bodies, names, estates, relations, and employments; together with death itself.

notes_zh: 地狱是罪最终的刑罚：永远与神隔绝，灵魂和身体永远受苦。这严肃的真理提醒我们福音的宝贵。
question_zh: 问29：因着罪，我们在来世要承受怎样的刑罚？
question_en: What are the punishments of sin in the world to come?
answer_en: The punishments of sin in the world to come, are everlasting separation from the comfortable presence of God, and most grievous torments in soul and body, without intermission, in hell-fire forever.
answer_zh: 答：罪在来世的刑罚是：与神美好的同在永远隔绝，灵魂和身体在地狱的永火中遭受悲惨、剧烈、没有止息的痛苦，直到永永远远1。
notes_en: Hell is the ultimate penalty of sin: eternal separation from God and everlasting torment. This solemn truth highlights the preciousness of the gospel.
question: What are the punishments of sin in the world to come?
answer: The punishments of sin in the world to come, are everlasting separation from the comfortable presence of God, and most grievous torments in soul and body, without intermission, in hell-fire forever.

notes_zh: 这是福音的开始！神出于祂白白的恩典，不是任凭所有人灭亡，而是拣选一些人，藉恩典之约拯救他们。
question_zh: 问30：神任凭全人类在罪恶和苦境中灭亡吗？
question_en: Doth God leave all mankind to perish in the estate of sin and misery?
answer_en: God doth not leave all men to perish in the estate of sin and misery, into which they fell by the breach of the first covenant, commonly called the covenant of works; but of his mere love and mercy delivereth his elect out of it, and bringeth them into an estate of salvation by the second covenant, commonly called the covenant of grace.
answer_zh: 答：全人类之所以落入罪恶和苦境，是因为他们违背了第一个约——即所谓的行为之约（covenant of work）1；但神并没有任凭他们就此灭亡2，反而出于祂全然的大爱和怜悯，借着第二个约——即所谓的恩典之约（covenant of grace），把祂的选民从其中救拔出来，并带领他们进入得救的境况3。
notes_en: Here the gospel begins! Out of sheer grace, God does not leave all to perish but elects some and saves them through the covenant of grace.
question: Doth God leave all mankind to perish in the estate of sin and misery?
answer: God doth not leave all men to perish in the estate of sin and misery, into which they fell by the breach of the first covenant, commonly called the covenant of works; but of his mere love and mercy delivereth his elect out of it, and bringeth them into an estate of salvation by the second covenant, commonly called the covenant of grace.

notes_zh: 恩典之约的核心人物是基督。正如亚当代表全人类堕落，基督代表选民成就救赎。
question_zh: 问31：神与谁立此恩典之约？
question_en: With whom was the covenant of grace made?
answer_en: The covenant of grace was made with Christ as the second Adam, and in him with all the elect as his seed.
answer_zh: 答：这恩典之约是神与第二个亚当（基督）立的，并且是在祂（基督）里面，与作为其后裔的所有选民所立的1。
notes_en: Christ is the central figure of the covenant of grace. As Adam represented all in the Fall, Christ represents the elect in redemption.
question: With whom was the covenant of grace made?
answer: The covenant of grace was made with Christ as the second Adam, and in him with all the elect as his seed.

notes_zh: 恩典之约中，神白白赐下中保（基督）、赐下圣灵产生信心、赐下一切救恩的恩典。信心本身也是神的恩赐。
question_zh: 问32：神的恩典如何在第二个恩约中显明？
question_en: How is the grace of God manifested in the second covenant?
answer_en: The grace of God is manifested in the second covenant, in that he freely provideth and offereth to sinners a mediator, and life and salvation by him; and requiring faith as the condition to interest them in him, promiseth and giveth his Holy Spirit to all his elect, to work in them that faith, with all other saving graces; and to enable them unto all holy obedience, as the evidence of the truth of their faith and thankfulness to God, and as the way which he hath appointed them to salvation.
answer_zh: 答：（一）在此恩约里，神白白地向罪人提供了一位中保1，靠着这位中保就可以得生命和救赎2，但他们必须以信心与中保连结3；（二）又应许并赐下圣灵4给祂的选民，使他们能生发出这种信心5，并赐下其他的得救恩典6；（三）也使他们能够顺服7，作为真信心8 和对神感恩9 的凭据，祂也以此作为选民的得救方式10。
notes_en: In the covenant of grace, God freely provides a Mediator (Christ), gives the Spirit to produce faith, and bestows all saving graces. Even faith itself is God's gift.
question: How is the grace of God manifested in the second covenant?
answer: The grace of God is manifested in the second covenant, in that he freely provideth and offereth to sinners a mediator, and life and salvation by him; and requiring faith as the condition to interest them in him, promiseth and giveth his Holy Spirit to all his elect, to work in them that faith, with all other saving graces; and to enable them unto all holy obedience, as the evidence of the truth of their faith and thankfulness to God, and as the way which he hath appointed them to salvation.

notes_zh: 恩典之约在本质上是一个约，但在旧约和新约中以不同方式施行。旧约以预表和应许，新约以成就和实现。
question_zh: 问33：这恩典之约始终都是以同一种方式施行的吗？
question_en: Was the covenant of grace always administered after one and the same manner?
answer_en: The covenant of grace was not always administered after the same manner, but the administrations of it under the Old Testament were different from those under the New.
answer_zh: 答：这恩典之约，在旧约时代的施行方式与在新约时代的施行方式并不相同1。
notes_en: The covenant of grace is one covenant in substance but administered differently in Old and New Testaments — through types and promises, then through fulfillment.
question: Was the covenant of grace always administered after one and the same manner?
answer: The covenant of grace was not always administered after the same manner, but the administrations of it under the Old Testament were different from those under the New.

notes_zh: 旧约的所有仪式和预表都指向基督。旧约信徒也是靠基督得救的，只是他们是向前看，我们是向后看。
question_zh: 问34：在旧约时代，这恩典之约是如何施行的？
question_en: How was the covenant of grace administered under the Old Testament?
answer_en: The covenant of grace was administered under the Old Testament, by promises, prophecies, sacrifices, circumcision, the passover, and other types and ordinances, which did all foresignify Christ then to come, and were for that time sufficient to build up the elect in faith in the promised messiah, by whom they then had full remission of sin, and eternal salvation.
answer_zh: 答：旧约时代，恩典之约是借着应许1、预言2、献祭3、割礼4、逾越节5及其他的预表和律例而施行的，这些都是指向以后要来的基督；而且在那时候，这些就足以建造选民的信心，使他们相信那位应许中的弥赛亚6 ——因着祂，他们的过犯得以完全赦免，并得着永远的救恩 7。
notes_en: All Old Testament ceremonies and types pointed to Christ. Old Testament believers were also saved through Christ — they looked forward; we look back.
question: How was the covenant of grace administered under the Old Testament?
answer: The covenant of grace was administered under the Old Testament, by promises, prophecies, sacrifices, circumcision, the passover, and other types and ordinances, which did all foresignify Christ then to come, and were for that time sufficient to build up the elect in faith in the promised messiah, by whom they then had full remission of sin, and eternal salvation.

notes_zh: 新约的施行方式更简单、更清晰：讲道、洗礼和圣餐。基督已经来了，预表变成了实体，恩典更加丰盛。
question_zh: 问35：在新约时代，这恩典之约又是如何施行的？
question_en: How is the covenant of grace administered under the New Testament?
answer_en: Under the New Testament, when Christ the substance was exhibited, the same covenant of grace was and still is to be administered in the preaching of the word, and the administration of the sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper; in which grace and salvation are held forth in more fullness, evidence, and efficacy, to all nations.
answer_zh: 答：新约时代，实体（基督）已经显明出来，这恩典之约不单在当时、在以后也仍然是借着圣道的传讲1、洗礼2和圣餐3而施行的；借着这些，恩典和救恩会更丰盛、更明显、更有果效地向万民发出4。
notes_en: New Testament administration is simpler and clearer: preaching, baptism, and the Lord's Supper. Christ has come; types give way to substance, and grace is more abundant.
question: How is the covenant of grace administered under the New Testament?
answer: Under the New Testament, when Christ the substance was exhibited, the same covenant of grace was and still is to be administered in the preaching of the word, and the administration of the sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper; in which grace and salvation are held forth in more fullness, evidence, and efficacy, to all nations.

notes_zh: 耶稣基督是唯一的中保。祂是完全的神也是完全的人，两个本性联合在一个位格中。这使祂能够代表神和人。
question_zh: 问36：谁是这恩典之约的中保？
question_en: Who is the mediator of the covenant of grace?
answer_en: The only mediator of the covenant of grace is the Lord Jesus Christ, who, being the eternal Son of God, of one substance and equal with the Father, in the fullness of time became man, and so was and continues to be God and man, in two entire distinct natures, and one person, forever.
answer_zh: 答：这恩典之约的惟一中保就是主耶稣基督1，祂是神的永恒之子，与父同质、同等2；在时候满足时，降世为人3，所以祂曾经是、且继续一直是神又是人，神人两性全然不同，并存于同一个位格之中，直到永远4。
notes_en: Jesus Christ is the only Mediator. He is fully God and fully man, two natures united in one person. This uniquely qualifies Him to represent both God and humanity.
question: Who is the mediator of the covenant of grace?
answer: The only mediator of the covenant of grace is the Lord Jesus Christ, who, being the eternal Son of God, of one substance and equal with the Father, in the fullness of time became man, and so was and continues to be God and man, in two entire distinct natures, and one person, forever.

notes_zh: 道成肉身是奇妙的奥秘。基督取了真实的人性（身体和灵魂），由童贞女所生，却完全没有罪。这确保了祂能作无瑕疵的祭物。
question_zh: 问37：基督──神的儿子，是如何成为人的？
question_en: How did Christ, being the Son of God, become man?
answer_en: Christ the Son of God became man, by taking to himself a true body, and a reasonable soul, being conceived by the power of the Holy Ghost in the womb of the virgin Mary, of her substance, and born of her, yet without sin.
answer_zh: 答：基督──神的儿子，自己取了人真实的身体和理性的灵魂1，借着圣灵的大能在童女马利亚腹中成孕，由她取了人性，从她出生2，只是祂没有罪3。
notes_en: The incarnation is a wondrous mystery. Christ took true humanity (body and soul), born of a virgin, yet entirely without sin — qualifying Him as the spotless sacrifice.
question: How did Christ, being the Son of God, become man?
answer: Christ the Son of God became man, by taking to himself a true body, and a reasonable soul, being conceived by the power of the Holy Ghost in the womb of the virgin Mary, of her substance, and born of her, yet without sin.

notes_zh: 只有神才能承受无限的刑罚、满足神的公义、赐下圣灵。如果中保只是人，祂的受苦没有无限的价值来救赎选民。
question_zh: 问38：为什么这位中保必须是神？
question_en: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be God?
answer_en: It was requisite that the mediator should be God, that he might sustain and keep the human nature from sinking under the infinite wrath of God, and the power of death; give worth and efficacy to his sufferings, obedience, and intercession; and to satisfy God's justice, procure his favor, purchase a peculiar people, give his Spirit to them, conquer all their enemies, and bring them to everlasting salvation.
answer_zh: 答：（一）这位中保必须是神，才能支撑、保持其人性，不至于在神极大的忿怒和死亡的权势之下沉沦1；（二）这也使祂的受苦、顺服、代求有价值和果效2；并且能满足神的公义3，获得祂的恩宠4，买赎一群特定的子民5，把祂的灵赐给他们6，制伏他们所有的仇敌7，带给他们永远的救恩8。
notes_en: Only God could endure infinite wrath, satisfy divine justice, and give the Spirit. If the Mediator were merely human, His suffering would lack infinite worth to redeem the elect.
question: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be God?
answer: It was requisite that the mediator should be God, that he might sustain and keep the human nature from sinking under the infinite wrath of God, and the power of death; give worth and efficacy to his sufferings, obedience, and intercession; and to satisfy God's justice, procure his favor, purchase a peculiar people, give his Spirit to them, conquer all their enemies, and bring them to everlasting salvation.

notes_zh: 中保必须是人，才能在人的本性中顺服律法、代替人受苦、体恤人的软弱。基督的人性使我们可以亲近祂。
question_zh: 问39：为什么这位中保必须是人？
question_en: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be man?
answer_en: It was requisite that the mediator should be man, that he might advance our nature, perform obedience to the law, suffer and make intercession for us in our nature, have a fellow-feeling of our infirmities; that we might receive the adoption of sons, and have comfort and access with boldness unto the throne of grace.
answer_zh: 答：这位中保必须是人，如此祂才能：（一）提昇我们的本性1，顺服在律法之下2；（二）在与我们相同的本性中为我们受苦、为我们代求3，体恤我们的软弱4；（三）如此我们也才能得着儿子的名分5，坦然无惧地来到施恩宝座前得蒙安慰6。
notes_en: The Mediator must be human to obey the law in our nature, suffer in our place, sympathize with our weaknesses, and give us access to God.
question: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be man?
answer: It was requisite that the mediator should be man, that he might advance our nature, perform obedience to the law, suffer and make intercession for us in our nature, have a fellow-feeling of our infirmities; that we might receive the adoption of sons, and have comfort and access with boldness unto the throne of grace.

notes_zh: 神人两性必须联合在一个位格中，这样祂作为一个完整的人所做的一切（顺服、受苦、代求）才对我们有效。
question_zh: 问40：为什么这位中保必须同时是神又是人，且在一个位格之中？
question_en: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be God and man in one person?
answer_en: It was requisite that the mediator, who was to reconcile God and man, should himself be both God and man, and this in one person, that the proper works of each nature might be accepted of God for us, and relied on by us, as the works of the whole person.
answer_zh: 答：这位使神与人和好的中保，必须自己同时是神又是人（二性在同一个位格内）；如此，在一个完整位格里，每一性的工作，不单可以为神所悦纳1，并且也可以成为我们的依靠2。
notes_en: The two natures must be united in one person so that everything He does as one complete person (obedience, suffering, intercession) is effective for us.
question: Why was it requisite that the mediator should be God and man in one person?
answer: It was requisite that the mediator, who was to reconcile God and man, should himself be both God and man, and this in one person, that the proper works of each nature might be accepted of God for us, and relied on by us, as the works of the whole person.

notes_zh: 「耶稣」的意思是「耶和华拯救」。这名字总结了祂来到世上的使命：拯救祂的百姓脱离罪恶。
question_zh: 问41：为什么我们的中保被称为耶稣？
question_en: Why was our mediator called Jesus?
answer_en: Our mediator was called Jesus, because he saveth his people from their sins.
answer_zh: 答：因为祂要将自己的百姓从罪恶里救出来1。
notes_en: "Jesus" means "the Lord saves." This name summarizes His mission: to save His people from their sins.
question: Why was our mediator called Jesus?
answer: Our mediator was called Jesus, because he saveth his people from their sins.

notes_zh: 「基督」意为「受膏者」。基督集先知、祭司、君王三个职分于一身。旧约的先知、祭司和君王都预表了祂。
question_zh: 问42：为什么我们的中保被称为基督？
question_en: Why was our mediator called Christ?
answer_en: Our mediator was called Christ, because he was anointed with the Holy Ghost above measure; and so set apart, and fully furnished with all authority and ability, to execute the offices of prophet, priest, and king of his church, in the estate both of his humiliation and exaltation.
answer_zh: 答：因为祂受圣灵无限量的膏抹1；并且被分别出来，具备各样的权柄和能力2，好使祂无论是在降卑或升高的境况中，都能为其教会执行先知3、祭司4 与君王5 的职分。
notes_en: "Christ" means "anointed one." Christ holds three offices: prophet, priest, and king. Old Testament prophets, priests, and kings all foreshadowed Him.
question: Why was our mediator called Christ?
answer: Our mediator was called Christ, because he was anointed with the Holy Ghost above measure; and so set apart, and fully furnished with all authority and ability, to execute the offices of prophet, priest, and king of his church, in the estate both of his humiliation and exaltation.

notes_zh: 基督作为先知，在各个时代通过圣灵和圣道向教会启示神的旨意。祂是神对我们说话的最终方式。
question_zh: 问43：基督怎样履行先知的职分？
question_en: How doth Christ execute the office of a prophet?
answer_en: Christ executeth the office of a prophet, in his revealing to the church, in all ages, by his Spirit and word, in divers ways of administration, the whole will of God, in all things concerning their edification and salvation.
answer_zh: 答：基督借着祂的圣灵和道1，以各种不同的方式，向历世历代的教会启示2 神全备的旨意3 ──特别是关乎他们被建造和得救恩的事宜4。这样，基督就履行了先知的职分。
notes_en: As prophet, Christ reveals God's will to His church in every age through His Spirit and Word. He is God's definitive revelation to us.
question: How doth Christ execute the office of a prophet?
answer: Christ executeth the office of a prophet, in his revealing to the church, in all ages, by his Spirit and word, in divers ways of administration, the whole will of God, in all things concerning their edification and salvation.

notes_zh: 基督作为祭司有两方面的工作：一次献上自己为赎罪祭（已完成），以及不断为我们代求（持续进行）。
question_zh: 问44：基督如何履行祭司的职分？
question_en: How doth Christ execute the office of a priest?
answer_en: Christ executeth the office of a priest, in his once offering himself a sacrifice without spot to God, to be a reconciliation for the sins of the people; and in making continual intercession for them.
answer_zh: 答：基督为百姓的罪，将自己作为无瑕无疵的祭物，一次向神献上1，使神与他们和好2；并为他们继续代求3。这样，基督就履行了祭司的职分。
notes_en: Christ's priestly work has two aspects: His once-for-all sacrifice for sin (completed) and His continual intercession for us (ongoing).
question: How doth Christ execute the office of a priest?
answer: Christ executeth the office of a priest, in his once offering himself a sacrifice without spot to God, to be a reconciliation for the sins of the people; and in making continual intercession for them.

notes_zh: 基督作为君王统管教会和万有。祂呼召、保护、管教祂的百姓，也审判不信的人。祂的国度是不能震动的。
question_zh: 问45：基督如何履行君王的职分？
question_en: How doth Christ execute the office of a king?
answer_en: Christ executeth the office of a king, in calling out of the world a people to himself, and giving them officers, laws, and censures, by which he visibly governs them; in bestowing saving grace upon his elect, rewarding their obedience, and correcting them for their sins, preserving and supporting them under all their temptations and sufferings, restraining and overcoming all their enemies, and powerfully ordering all things for his own glory, and their good; and also in taking vengeance on the rest, who know not God, and obey not the gospel.
answer_zh: 答：（一）基督从世界召出一群子民，归祂自己1，又赐下一批人管理他们2，也赐下律法3，就以这个有形的方式治理他们4；（二）祂也把救赎恩典赐给选民5，报赏他们的顺服6，纠正他们的过犯7，又在各样的试探和苦难中保守并扶持他们8，克制、征服他们所有的仇敌9；（三）祂为自己的荣耀10，也为他们的益处11，以大能调度万有；又报应其馀那些不认识神、不顺从福音的人12。这样，基督就履行了君王的职分。
notes_en: As king, Christ rules His church and all things. He calls, protects, and disciplines His people, and judges the unbelieving. His kingdom is unshakeable.
question: How doth Christ execute the office of a king?
answer: Christ executeth the office of a king, in calling out of the world a people to himself, and giving them officers, laws, and censures, by which he visibly governs them; in bestowing saving grace upon his elect, rewarding their obedience, and correcting them for their sins, preserving and supporting them under all their temptations and sufferings, restraining and overcoming all their enemies, and powerfully ordering all things for his own glory, and their good; and also in taking vengeance on the rest, who know not God, and obey not the gospel.

notes_zh: 基督的降卑贯穿了祂在世生活的每一个阶段：从出生在马槽到死在十字架上。祂为了我们放弃了天上的荣耀。
question_zh: 问46：基督的降卑在于什么？
question_en: What was the estate of Christ's humiliation?
answer_en: The estate of Christ's humiliation was that low condition, wherein he for our sakes, emptying himself of his glory, took upon him the form of a servant, in his conception and birth, life, death, and after his death, until his resurrection.
answer_zh: 答：基督的降卑在于祂为了我们的缘故，舍弃自己的荣耀（虚己），取了奴仆的形像，从祂的受孕、降生、生活、受死，乃至死后、直到复活之前，这段时间都是处于卑微的境况中1。
notes_en: Christ's humiliation spanned His entire earthly life: from birth in a manger to death on a cross. He emptied Himself of glory for our sake.
question: What was the estate of Christ's humiliation?
answer: The estate of Christ's humiliation was that low condition, wherein he for our sakes, emptying himself of his glory, took upon him the form of a servant, in his conception and birth, life, death, and after his death, until his resurrection.

notes_zh: 永恒的神子成为人子，从卑微的女子所生——这本身就是无法测度的降卑。万王之王竟生在马槽里。
question_zh: 问47：在基督的成孕和降生中，基督是如何降卑自己的？
question_en: How did Christ humble himself in his conception and birth?
answer_en: Christ humbled himself in his conception and birth, in that, being from all eternity the Son of God, in the bosom of the Father, he was pleased in the fullness of time to become the son of man, made of a woman of low estate, and to be born of her; with divers circumstances of more than ordinary abasement.
answer_zh: 答：基督在受孕和降生中降卑自己，是在于祂本为天父怀中的永恒之子，却在时候满足时，甘愿成为人之子，由一位卑微的女人而生；祂所处的各样环境，比一般的屈尊都更卑微1。
notes_en: The eternal Son of God became the son of man, born of a lowly woman — this is immeasurable condescension. The King of kings was born in a manger.
question: How did Christ humble himself in his conception and birth?
answer: Christ humbled himself in his conception and birth, in that, being from all eternity the Son of God, in the bosom of the Father, he was pleased in the fullness of time to become the son of man, made of a woman of low estate, and to be born of her; with divers circumstances of more than ordinary abasement.

notes_zh: 基督完全顺服律法，为我们赢得了义。祂经历了人世间的一切苦难和试探，却没有犯罪。
question_zh: 问48：在生活中，基督是如何降卑自己的？
question_en: How did Christ humble himself in his life?
answer_en: Christ humbled himself in his life, by subjecting himself to the law, which he perfectly fulfilled; and by conflicting with the indignities of the world, temptations of Satan, and infirmities in his flesh, whether common to the nature of man, or particularly accompanying that his low condition.
answer_zh: 答：基督在祂的生活中降卑自己，是在于祂将自己服在律法（祂也完美地成全了这个律法1）之下2 ，并面对世上的各样侮辱3、撒但的试探4、自己肉身的软弱，这些或是常见于人的性情，或是特别因着降卑而有的光景5。
notes_en: Christ perfectly obeyed the law, earning righteousness for us. He endured all human suffering and temptation, yet without sin.
question: How did Christ humble himself in his life?
answer: Christ humbled himself in his life, by subjecting himself to the law, which he perfectly fulfilled; and by conflicting with the indignities of the world, temptations of Satan, and infirmities in his flesh, whether common to the nature of man, or particularly accompanying that his low condition.

notes_zh: 基督的死是最深的降卑：被门徒离弃，被世人弃绝，承受神的忿怒，死在咒诅的十字架上。这一切都是为了我们。
question_zh: 问49：在祂的受死中，基督是如何降卑自己的？
question_en: How did Christ humble himself in his death?
answer_en: Christ humbled himself in his death, in that having been betrayed by Judas, forsaken by his disciples, scorned and rejected by the world, condemned by Pilate, and tormented by his persecutors; having also conflicted with the terrors of death, and the powers of darkness, felt and borne the weight of God's wrath, he laid down his life an offering for sin, enduring the painful, shameful, and cursed death of the cross.
answer_zh: 答：（一）祂为犹大所背叛1，遭门徒离弃2，受世人的嘲弄和弃绝3，被彼拉多定罪，被官长、兵丁折磨4；（二）祂也为死亡的恐怖、黑暗的权势所苦，承受神忿怒的重压5；（三）祂将命倾倒，为罪献上自己6，忍受了十字架上痛苦的、羞耻的、受咒诅的死亡7。
notes_en: Christ's death was the deepest humiliation: forsaken by disciples, rejected by the world, bearing God's wrath, dying a cursed death on the cross — all for us.
question: How did Christ humble himself in his death?
answer: Christ humbled himself in his death, in that having been betrayed by Judas, forsaken by his disciples, scorned and rejected by the world, condemned by Pilate, and tormented by his persecutors; having also conflicted with the terrors of death, and the powers of darkness, felt and borne the weight of God's wrath, he laid down his life an offering for sin, enduring the painful, shameful, and cursed death of the cross.

notes_zh: 基督的降卑不止于死亡，还包括被埋葬和在死亡权势下的状态。「降到阴间」指的是祂经历了死亡的完全状态。
question_zh: 问50：基督死后的降卑在于什么？
question_en: Wherein consisted Christ's humiliation after his death?
answer_en: Christ's humiliation after his death consisted in his being buried, and continuing in the state of the dead, and under the power of death till the third day; which hath been otherwise expressed in these words, He descended into hell.
answer_zh: 答：基督死后的降卑是在于祂被埋葬1，且一直持续处于死亡的状态、死亡的权势之下，直到第三日2；用另一种说法就是祂「下到阴间」。
notes_en: Christ's humiliation continued beyond death to burial and remaining under death's power. 'Descended into hell' refers to His experiencing the full state of death.
question: Wherein consisted Christ's humiliation after his death?
answer: Christ's humiliation after his death consisted in his being buried, and continuing in the state of the dead, and under the power of death till the third day; which hath been otherwise expressed in these words, He descended into hell.

notes_zh: 基督的升高与祂的降卑形成对比。从坟墓到宝座，基督完成了救赎工作并得到了荣耀。
question_zh: 问51：基督的升高在于什么？
question_en: What was the estate of Christ's exaltation?
answer_en: The estate of Christ's exaltation comprehendeth his resurrection, ascension, sitting at the right hand of the Father, and his coming again to judge the world.
answer_zh: 答：基督的升高在于复活1、升天2、坐在父的右边3，并且再临要审判世界4。
notes_en: Christ's exaltation contrasts with His humiliation. From the grave to the throne, Christ completed redemption and received glory.
question: What was the estate of Christ's exaltation?
answer: The estate of Christ's exaltation comprehendeth his resurrection, ascension, sitting at the right hand of the Father, and his coming again to judge the world.

notes_zh: 基督的复活是基督徒信仰的核心事件。祂以同一个身体复活，但这身体已被改变，不再受死亡和软弱的辖制。
question_zh: 问52：在祂的复活中，基督是如何升高的？
question_en: How was Christ exalted in his resurrection?
answer_en: Christ was exalted in his resurrection, in that, not having seen corruption in death (of which it was not possible for him to be held), and having the very same body in which he suffered, with the essential properties thereof (but without mortality, and other common infirmities belonging to this life), really united to his soul, he rose again from the dead the third day by his own power; whereby he declared himself to be the Son of God, to have satisfied divine justice, to have vanquished death, and him that had power of it, and to be Lord of quick and dead: all which he did as a public person, the head of his church, for their justification, quickening in grace, support against enemies, and to assure them of their resurrection from the dead at the last day.
answer_zh: 答：（一）祂并没有在死亡中见朽坏1，并且第三天，基督以祂受苦时的那个身体2（但不再有今世这个生命都会面临的必死性，以及其他凡人必有的软弱），来与祂的灵魂联合3，祂靠自己的权柄从死里复活4；（二）祂以此显明自己是神的儿子5，满足了神的公义6，征服了死亡、败坏了那掌死权的7，成为活人死人的主8。祂以教会元首的身分9为众人10行这些事，是为了使他们称义11、在恩典中活过来12、支持他们抵挡仇敌13，并保证他们在末日时必能从死里复活14。
notes_en: Christ's resurrection is the cornerstone of Christian faith. He rose in the same body but transformed — no longer subject to death or mortal weakness.
question: How was Christ exalted in his resurrection?
answer: Christ was exalted in his resurrection, in that, not having seen corruption in death (of which it was not possible for him to be held), and having the very same body in which he suffered, with the essential properties thereof (but without mortality, and other common infirmities belonging to this life), really united to his soul, he rose again from the dead the third day by his own power; whereby he declared himself to be the Son of God, to have satisfied divine justice, to have vanquished death, and him that had power of it, and to be Lord of quick and dead: all which he did as a public person, the head of his church, for their justification, quickening in grace, support against enemies, and to assure them of their resurrection from the dead at the last day.

notes_zh: 基督以人性升天，表明祂永远是我们的中保。祂的升天不是离开，而是以更大的能力与权柄继续祂的工作。
question_zh: 问53：在升天中，基督是如何升高的？
question_en: How was Christ exalted in his ascension?
answer_en: Christ was exalted in his ascension, in that having after his resurrection often appeared unto and conversed with his apostles, speaking to them of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God, and giving them commission to preach the gospel to all nations, forty days after his resurrection, he, in our nature, and as our head, triumphing over enemies, visibly went up into the highest heavens, there to receive gifts for men, to raise up our affections thither, and to prepare a place for us, where himself is, and shall continue till his second coming at the end of the world.
answer_zh: 答：（一）祂复活之后，经常向门徒显现，与他们交谈──向他们讲说神国的事1，并且把向万国传福音的使命交讬给他们2；（二）四十天之后，祂带着与我们一样的性情，以教会元首3（祂已掳掠了仇敌4）的身分，在众目注视之下，升上高天，将各样的恩赐赏给人5，也把我们的情感、思念提升到彼处6，并为我们预备地方7，而祂也将一直留在那里，直等到世界的末了，祂将再次降临8。
notes_en: Christ ascended in human nature, forever our mediator. His ascension was not departure but continuation of His work with greater power and authority.
question: How was Christ exalted in his ascension?
answer: Christ was exalted in his ascension, in that having after his resurrection often appeared unto and conversed with his apostles, speaking to them of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God, and giving them commission to preach the gospel to all nations, forty days after his resurrection, he, in our nature, and as our head, triumphing over enemies, visibly went up into the highest heavens, there to receive gifts for men, to raise up our affections thither, and to prepare a place for us, where himself is, and shall continue till his second coming at the end of the world.

notes_zh: 基督坐在父的右边不是静止不动，而是积极地统管万有、保护教会、为信徒代求。祂现在就是万有的主。
question_zh: 问54：基督是如何在「坐在父的右边」一事上升高的？
question_en: How is Christ exalted in his sitting at the right hand of God?
answer_en: Christ is exalted in his sitting at the right hand of God, in that as God-man he is advanced to the highest favor with God the Father, with all fullness of joy, glory, and power over all things in heaven and earth; and doth gather and defend his church, and subdue their enemies; furnisheth his ministers and people with gifts and graces, and maketh intercession for them.
answer_zh: 答：（一）祂既是神，又是人，被父神升为至高1，满有喜乐2、荣耀3，并得着胜过天上地下一切的权柄4；（二）祂招聚、护卫祂的教会，制伏他们的仇敌；又用各样恩赐和恩典5，装备祂的仆人和子民，并为他们代求6。
notes_en: Christ at the Father's right hand is not passive but actively ruling all things, protecting His church, and interceding for believers.
question: How is Christ exalted in his sitting at the right hand of God?
answer: Christ is exalted in his sitting at the right hand of God, in that as God-man he is advanced to the highest favor with God the Father, with all fullness of joy, glory, and power over all things in heaven and earth; and doth gather and defend his church, and subdue their enemies; furnisheth his ministers and people with gifts and graces, and maketh intercession for them.

notes_zh: 基督的代求是我们信心和平安的坚固根基。即使我们每天犯罪跌倒，基督仍在天上为我们代求。
question_zh: 问55：基督如何代求？
question_en: How doth Christ make intercession?
answer_en: Christ maketh intercession, by his appearing in our nature continually before the Father in heaven, in the merit of his obedience and sacrifice on earth, declaring his will to have it applied to all believers; answering all accusations against them, and procuring for them quiet of conscience, notwithstanding daily failings, access with boldness to the throne of grace, and acceptance of their persons and services.
answer_zh: 答：（一）基督因着在地上顺服与献祭的功劳1，一直在天父面前为我们代求2，要把这功劳应用到所有信徒的身上3；（二）尽管他们天天有失败之处，但基督驳回一切对他们的控告4，为他们成就良心的平安5，使他们可以坦然无惧地来到施恩宝座前6，并使他们自己7和他们的服事都蒙悦纳8。
notes_en: Christ's intercession is the firm ground of our faith and peace. Even amid daily failings, Christ continually advocates for us before the Father.
question: How doth Christ make intercession?
answer: Christ maketh intercession, by his appearing in our nature continually before the Father in heaven, in the merit of his obedience and sacrifice on earth, declaring his will to have it applied to all believers; answering all accusations against them, and procuring for them quiet of conscience, notwithstanding daily failings, access with boldness to the throne of grace, and acceptance of their persons and services.

notes_zh: 曾被不义审判的基督将以公义审判全世界。祂的再来将是荣耀的、公开的、不可抗拒的。
question_zh: 问56：基督是如何在「将来再临、审判世界」一事上升高的？
question_en: How is Christ to be exalted in his coming again to judge the world?
answer_en: Christ is to be exalted in his coming again to judge the world, in that he, who was unjustly judged and condemned by wicked men, shall come again at the last day in great power, and in the full manifestation of his own glory, and of his Father's, with all his holy angels, with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God, to judge the world in righteousness.
answer_zh: 答：祂虽受到不义的审判、被恶人定罪1，却要在末日之时，与千万的圣天使2大有权能地再临3，有呼叫的声音和天使长的声音，又有神的号吹响4，祂将完全彰显祂自己和父的荣耀，以公义审判这个世界5。
notes_en: The One unjustly judged will return as the righteous Judge. His coming will be glorious, public, and irresistible.
question: How is Christ to be exalted in his coming again to judge the world?
answer: Christ is to be exalted in his coming again to judge the world, in that he, who was unjustly judged and condemned by wicked men, shall come again at the last day in great power, and in the full manifestation of his own glory, and of his Father's, with all his holy angels, with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God, to judge the world in righteousness.

notes_zh: 基督中保工作的成果是全面的救赎。恩典之约中的一切益处都是通过基督获得的。
question_zh: 问57：基督借着中保的工作，得到了什么益处（benefit）？
question_en: What benefits hath Christ procured by his mediation?
answer_en: Christ, by his mediation, hath procured redemption, with all other benefits of the covenant of grace.
answer_zh: 答：基督借着中保的工作，得到了恩典之约中每一项益处；其中包括救赎1，但也包括其他的益处2。
notes_en: Christ's mediatorial work secures comprehensive redemption. All benefits of the covenant of grace are obtained through Christ.
question: What benefits hath Christ procured by his mediation?
answer: Christ, by his mediation, hath procured redemption, with all other benefits of the covenant of grace.

notes_zh: 基督获得了救赎，圣灵将这救赎施用于我们。三位一体的神在救恩中各有分工，彼此配合。
question_zh: 问58：我们如何分享基督所买赎回来的益处呢？
question_en: How do we come to be made partakers of the benefits which Christ hath procured?
answer_en: We are made partakers of the benefits which Christ hath procured, by the application of them unto us, which is the work especially of God the Holy Ghost.
answer_zh: 答：我们得以分享基督买赎回来的益处，乃是圣灵特别的工作1，祂把这些益处施行在我们身上2。
notes_en: Christ procured redemption; the Spirit applies it. The Trinity cooperates in salvation — each person with a distinct role.
question: How do we come to be made partakers of the benefits which Christ hath procured?
answer: We are made partakers of the benefits which Christ hath procured, by the application of them unto us, which is the work especially of God the Holy Ghost.

notes_zh: 救赎的施用是确实有效的。基督为谁死，圣灵就必定在他们心中作工，使他们信靠基督。
question_zh: 问59：谁与基督的救赎有分呢？
question_en: Who are made partakers of redemption through Christ?
answer_en: Redemption is certainly applied, and effectually communicated, to all those for whom Christ hath purchased it; who are in time by the Holy Ghost enabled to believe in Christ according to the gospel.
answer_zh: 答：救赎是必然地、有效地分赐、传给所有基督买赎的人1；在时候满足时，圣灵就使他们能够照着福音归信基督2。
notes_en: Redemption's application is certain and effective. Those for whom Christ died will be brought to faith by the Spirit.
question: Who are made partakers of redemption through Christ?
answer: Redemption is certainly applied, and effectually communicated, to all those for whom Christ hath purchased it; who are in time by the Holy Ghost enabled to believe in Christ according to the gospel.

notes_zh: 这一问答明确了基督的独一性和福音的必要性。任何其他宗教或道德努力都不能带来真正的救恩。
question_zh: 问60：那些从未听过福音，既不认识、也不相信基督耶稣的人，若按着天然的光来生活，他们是否能够由此得救呢？
question_en: Can they who have never heard the gospel, and so know not Jesus Christ, nor believe in him, be saved by their living according to the light of nature?
answer_en: They who, having never heard the gospel, know not Jesus Christ, and believe not in him, cannot be saved, be they never so diligent to frame their lives according to the light of nature, or the laws of that religion which they profess; neither is there salvation in any other, but in Christ alone, who is the Savior only of his body the church.
answer_zh: 答：那些从未听过福音1，因此既不认识基督耶稣，也不相信祂的人2，即使他们殷勤地按着天然的光3或他们所认信的宗教诫命，来调整自己的生活4，也不会得救的5；除了耶稣之外，别无救赎6，惟独祂是教会全体的救主7。
notes_en: This answer affirms the exclusivity of Christ and necessity of the gospel. No other religion or moral effort can bring true salvation.
question: Can they who have never heard the gospel, and so know not Jesus Christ, nor believe in him, be saved by their living according to the light of nature?
answer: They who, having never heard the gospel, know not Jesus Christ, and believe not in him, cannot be saved, be they never so diligent to frame their lives according to the light of nature, or the laws of that religion which they profess; neither is there salvation in any other, but in Christ alone, who is the Savior only of his body the church.

notes_zh: 在有形教会中并不保证得救。真正的救恩属于那些被神拣选、真心相信的人——无形教会的成员。
question_zh: 问61：那些听了福音并且加入教会生活的人，是不是都得救了？
question_en: Are all they saved who hear the gospel, and live in the church?
answer_en: All that hear the gospel, and live in the visible church, are not saved; but they only who are true members of the church invisible.
answer_zh: 答：并不是所有听了福音又加入有形教会（visible church）生活的人，都是得救的；惟有无形教会（invisible church）中的真成员（真实的肢体）才是得救的1。
notes_en: Membership in the visible church does not guarantee salvation. True salvation belongs to the elect who genuinely believe — members of the invisible church.
question: Are all they saved who hear the gospel, and live in the church?
answer: All that hear the gospel, and live in the visible church, are not saved; but they only who are true members of the church invisible.

notes_zh: 有形教会包括所有认信基督教信仰的人及他们的孩子。这是一个可见的、外在的群体。
question_zh: 问62：「有形的教会」是什么？
question_en: What is the visible church?
answer_en: The visible church is a society made up of all such as in all ages and places of the world do profess the true religion, and of their children.
answer_zh: 答：是由世上各个时代、各个地方凡认信真宗教的人1，和他们的子女2所组成的一个群体。
notes_en: The visible church includes all who profess the Christian faith and their children — an outward, visible society.
question: What is the visible church?
answer: The visible church is a society made up of all such as in all ages and places of the world do profess the true religion, and of their children.

notes_zh: 有形教会虽然不完美，却是神设立的蒙恩管道。在教会中我们享受神话语的宣讲、圣礼的施行和圣徒的相通。
question_zh: 问63：有形的教会享有什么特殊的权益？
question_en: What are the special privileges of the visible church?
answer_en: The visible church hath the privilege of being under God's special care and government; of being protected and preserved in all ages, notwithstanding the opposition of all enemies; and of enjoying the communion of saints, the ordinary means of salvation, and offers of grace by Christ to all the members of it in the ministry of the gospel, testifying, that whosoever believes in him shall be saved, and excluding none that will come unto him.
answer_zh: 答：有形的教会可蒙受神特别的眷顾和治理1；尽管有仇敌的抵挡，但仍在各个时代中蒙护佑、得保守2；享有圣徒彼此间的交通，也可使用蒙恩的管道（means of grace）3，并耶稣在福音中向其所有成员所发出之恩典的召请、见证4──一切信祂的人都会得救，来到祂面前的人，都不会被丢弃5。
notes_en: The visible church, though imperfect, is God's appointed means of grace. In it we enjoy the preaching of the Word, administration of sacraments, and fellowship of saints.
question: What are the special privileges of the visible church?
answer: The visible church hath the privilege of being under God's special care and government; of being protected and preserved in all ages, notwithstanding the opposition of all enemies; and of enjoying the communion of saints, the ordinary means of salvation, and offers of grace by Christ to all the members of it in the ministry of the gospel, testifying, that whosoever believes in him shall be saved, and excluding none that will come unto him.

notes_zh: 无形教会由神所拣选的人组成，只有神知道谁属于这个教会。它超越时间和空间的界限。
question_zh: 问64：「无形的教会」是什么？
question_en: What is the invisible church?
answer_en: The invisible church is the whole number of the elect, that have been, are, or shall be gathered into one under Christ the head.
answer_zh: 答：无形的教会包括过去、现在、未来，在元首基督名下聚集归一的所有选民1。
notes_en: The invisible church consists of God's elect — known only to God. It transcends all boundaries of time and space.
question: What is the invisible church?
answer: The invisible church is the whole number of the elect, that have been, are, or shall be gathered into one under Christ the head.

notes_zh: 与基督的联合是信徒一切福分的根源。在今世享受恩典中的联合，在来世享受荣耀中的联合。
question_zh: 问65：借着基督，无形教会的成员享有什么特殊的权益？
question_en: What special benefits do the members of the invisible church enjoy by Christ?
answer_en: The members of the invisible church by Christ enjoy union and communion with him in grace and glory.
answer_zh: 答：借着基督，无形教会的成员可在恩典与荣耀里享受与祂联合（union）、与祂相通（communion）1。
notes_en: Union with Christ is the source of all blessings for believers — union in grace now, and union in glory hereafter.
question: What special benefits do the members of the invisible church enjoy by Christ?
answer: The members of the invisible church by Christ enjoy union and communion with him in grace and glory.

notes_zh: 与基督的联合是奥秘的，却是真实的。圣经用元首与身体、丈夫与妻子的关系来描述这种亲密的联合。
question_zh: 问66：选民所享有的「与基督联合」是什么？
question_en: What is that union which the elect have with Christ?
answer_en: The union which the elect have with Christ is the work of God's grace, whereby they are spiritually and mystically, yet really and inseparably, joined to Christ as their head and husband; which is done in their effectual calling.
answer_zh: 答：选民与基督联合，完全是神恩典的作为1，他们与基督（其元首和丈夫）的联合2，虽然是属灵的、奥秘的，但却是真实的、不可分离的；这都是在有效的恩召（effectual calling）里所成就的3。
notes_en: Union with Christ is mystical yet real. Scripture uses head-body and husband-wife imagery to describe this intimate bond.
question: What is that union which the elect have with Christ?
answer: The union which the elect have with Christ is the work of God's grace, whereby they are spiritually and mystically, yet really and inseparably, joined to Christ as their head and husband; which is done in their effectual calling.

notes_zh: 有效的呼召是神主权恩典的彰显。不是人先选择神，而是神藉着圣灵改变人心，使人能够并愿意回应福音。
question_zh: 问67：什么是「有效的恩召」？
question_en: What is effectual calling?
answer_en: Effectual calling is the work of God's almighty power and grace, whereby (out of his free and special love to his elect, and from nothing in them moving him thereunto) he doth, in his accepted time, invite and draw them to Jesus Christ, by his word and Spirit; savingly enlightening their minds, renewing and powerfully determining their wills, so as they (although in themselves dead in sin) are hereby made willing and able freely to answer his call, and to accept and embrace the grace offered and conveyed therein.
answer_zh: 答：「有效的恩召」是神大能的作为，也是神恩典的作为1，这完全是出于祂对选民白白的、特别的爱，并不是因为他们有任何表现而促使祂这么做2。神在祂所悦纳的日子，借着祂的道和圣灵，邀请并吸引他们归向基督耶稣3；以救恩之光来光照他们的心思4，又大有权能地更新并调整他们的意志5，以致他们（虽然他们死在过犯罪恶之中）能甘心乐意地、自由地回应祂的呼召，领受由此而来的恩典6。
notes_en: Effectual calling displays God's sovereign grace. God changes hearts by His Spirit, enabling and making willing those who were dead in sin to respond to the gospel.
question: What is effectual calling?
answer: Effectual calling is the work of God's almighty power and grace, whereby (out of his free and special love to his elect, and from nothing in them moving him thereunto) he doth, in his accepted time, invite and draw them to Jesus Christ, by his word and Spirit; savingly enlightening their minds, renewing and powerfully determining their wills, so as they (although in themselves dead in sin) are hereby made willing and able freely to answer his call, and to accept and embrace the grace offered and conveyed therein.

notes_zh: 外在的呼召临到许多人，但有效的呼召只临到选民。那些拒绝福音的人是公义地被定罪的。
question_zh: 问68：惟独选民得蒙有效的恩召吗？
question_en: Are the elect only effectually called?
answer_en: All the elect, and they only, are effectually called; although others may be, and often are, outwardly called by the ministry of the word, and have some common operations of the Spirit; who, for their willful neglect and contempt of the grace offered to them, being justly left in their unbelief, do never truly come to Jesus Christ.
answer_zh: 答：所有的选民，而且惟独他们，才能得蒙有效的恩召1；尽管其他人或许经常蒙受外在的呼召2（这呼召是借着神的道的服事而发出的），并且有圣灵一般性的运行3，但他们故意忽略、轻视这赐给他们的恩典，所以就被神公义地弃置于他们自己的不信中，从没有真正地归向耶稣基督4。
notes_en: The outward call comes to many, but effectual calling reaches only the elect. Those who reject the gospel are justly condemned.
question: Are the elect only effectually called?
answer: All the elect, and they only, are effectually called; although others may be, and often are, outwardly called by the ministry of the word, and have some common operations of the Spirit; who, for their willful neglect and contempt of the grace offered to them, being justly left in their unbelief, do never truly come to Jesus Christ.

notes_zh: 与基督的相通在今生表现为称义、收养和成圣。这些都是与基督联合的果子。
question_zh: 问69：无形教会的成员在恩典里所享有的「与基督相通」是什么？
question_en: What is the communion in grace which the members of the invisible church have with Christ?
answer_en: The communion in grace which the members of the invisible church have with Christ, is their partaking of the virtue of his mediation, in their justification, adoption, sanctification, and whatever else, in this life, manifests their union with him.
answer_zh: 答：无形教会的成员在恩典里所享有的「与基督相通」，就是有分于中保的救赎工作，因而在称义1、得儿子的名分2、成圣，以及今世的一切事上，都显明他们与基督联合3。
notes_en: Communion with Christ in this life is expressed through justification, adoption, and sanctification — fruits of union with Christ.
question: What is the communion in grace which the members of the invisible church have with Christ?
answer: The communion in grace which the members of the invisible church have with Christ, is their partaking of the virtue of his mediation, in their justification, adoption, sanctification, and whatever else, in this life, manifests their union with him.

notes_zh: 称义是法律上的宣告，不是道德上的改变。神因基督的义归算给我们，宣告我们在祂面前为义。唯独信心是领受的工具。
question_zh: 问70：「称义」是什么？
question_en: What is justification?
answer_en: Justification is an act of God's free grace unto sinners, in which he pardoneth all their sins, accepteth and accounteth their persons righteous in his sight; not for anything wrought in them, or done by them, but only for the perfect obedience and full satisfaction of Christ, by God imputed to them, and received by faith alone.
answer_zh: 答：称义是神的作为，祂将白白的恩典赐给罪人1，借此赦免他们所有的罪、接纳他们，使他们在祂面前算为义2；这并不是因为他们自己有什么，也不是因为他们做了什么3，完全只是因为基督全然的顺服和完美的补赎，神便将这一切归与他们4，并且这一切都是惟独借着信心才能领受的5。
notes_en: Justification is a legal declaration, not a moral transformation. God declares us righteous on account of Christ's righteousness imputed to us, received by faith alone.
question: What is justification?
answer: Justification is an act of God's free grace unto sinners, in which he pardoneth all their sins, accepteth and accounteth their persons righteous in his sight; not for anything wrought in them, or done by them, but only for the perfect obedience and full satisfaction of Christ, by God imputed to them, and received by faith alone.

notes_zh: 称义完全是恩典，因为：（1）神提供了中保，（2）基督做了一切补赎，（3）连信心也是神的恩赐。人没有任何功劳可言。
question_zh: 问71：为什么说称义是神白白恩典的作为呢？
question_en: How is justification an act of God's free grace?
answer_en: Although Christ, by his obedience and death, did make a proper, real, and full satisfaction to God's justice in the behalf of them that are justified; yet inasmuch as God accepteth the satisfaction from a surety, which he might have demanded of them, and did provide this surety, his own only Son, imputing his righteousness to them, and requiring nothing of them for their justification but faith, which also is his gift, their justification is to them of free grace.
answer_zh: 答：尽管基督借着顺服和受死，代表那些被称义之人，对神的公义作出了适当的、真实的、完全的补赎1，但是，这位中保是神自己提供的（虽然这是祂可以要求他们的）──也就是祂的独生子2，并把祂的义归与他们3，使他们得以称义4（除了信心以外，向他们别无所求，但是连这信心，也是祂的恩赐5）。所以，他们的称义完全是因着白白的恩典6。
notes_en: Justification is entirely gracious because: (1) God provided the surety, (2) Christ made full satisfaction, and (3) even faith is God's gift. No human merit is involved.
question: How is justification an act of God's free grace?
answer: Although Christ, by his obedience and death, did make a proper, real, and full satisfaction to God's justice in the behalf of them that are justified; yet inasmuch as God accepteth the satisfaction from a surety, which he might have demanded of them, and did provide this surety, his own only Son, imputing his righteousness to them, and requiring nothing of them for their justification but faith, which also is his gift, their justification is to them of free grace.

notes_zh: 称义的信心不仅是头脑的认同，更是全人对基督的依靠和信赖。它包括认罪、认同真理、并以基督为唯一的拯救。
question_zh: 问72：「称义的信心」是什么？
question_en: What is justifying faith?
answer_en: Justifying faith is a saving grace, wrought in the heart of a sinner by the Spirit and Word of God, whereby he, being convinced of his sin and misery, and of the disability in himself and all other creatures to recover him out of his lost condition, not only assenteth to the truth of the promise of the gospel, but receiveth and resteth upon Christ and his righteousness, therein held forth, for pardon of sin, and for the accepting and accounting of his person righteous in the sight of God for salvation.
answer_zh: 答：（一）称义的信心是救赎的恩典1，由圣灵2和神的道3在罪人心中做成的，使他确知自己的罪恶和苦境，也知道自己或其他任何受造者都不能使他脱离失丧的光景4；（二）称义的信心不仅只是赞同福音应许的真理5，更是接受并信靠基督和祂的义，因而使罪得赦免6，在神面前得蒙悦纳，被算为义，以致得救7。
notes_en: Justifying faith is not mere intellectual assent but wholehearted reliance on Christ — involving conviction of sin, assent to gospel truth, and resting on Christ alone for salvation.
question: What is justifying faith?
answer: Justifying faith is a saving grace, wrought in the heart of a sinner by the Spirit and Word of God, whereby he, being convinced of his sin and misery, and of the disability in himself and all other creatures to recover him out of his lost condition, not only assenteth to the truth of the promise of the gospel, but receiveth and resteth upon Christ and his righteousness, therein held forth, for pardon of sin, and for the accepting and accounting of his person righteous in the sight of God for salvation.

notes_zh: 信心本身没有功劳。它只是领受基督之义的工具，就像空的手领受礼物一样。
question_zh: 问73：信心如何使罪人在神面前得称为义？
question_en: How doth faith justify a sinner in the sight of God?
answer_en: Faith justifies a sinner in the sight of God, not because of those other graces which do always accompany it, or of good works that are the fruits of it, nor as if the grace of faith, or any act thereof, were imputed to him for his justification; but only as it is an instrument by which he receiveth and applieth Christ and his righteousness.
answer_zh: 答：（一）信心使罪人在神面前得称为义，并不是靠着那些随信心而来的恩惠、或靠着信心所结的善行之果1，也不是把信心的恩惠、信心的行为归给罪人，好使他得称为义2；（二）信心使罪人在神面前得称为义，只是因为信心是器皿，借此罪人可以接受并支取基督和祂的义3。
notes_en: Faith itself has no merit. It is merely the instrument that receives Christ's righteousness — like an empty hand receiving a gift.
question: How doth faith justify a sinner in the sight of God?
answer: Faith justifies a sinner in the sight of God, not because of those other graces which do always accompany it, or of good works that are the fruits of it, nor as if the grace of faith, or any act thereof, were imputed to him for his justification; but only as it is an instrument by which he receiveth and applieth Christ and his righteousness.

notes_zh: 收养赋予信徒儿女的身份和权益。我们不仅被宣告为义，更被接纳进入神的家庭，成为祂的儿女。
question_zh: 问74：「得儿子的名分」是什么？
question_en: What is adoption?
answer_en: Adoption is an act of the free grace of God, in and for his only Son Jesus Christ, whereby all those that are justified are received into the number of his children, have his name put upon them, the Spirit of his Son given to them, are under his fatherly care and dispensations, admitted to all the liberties and privileges of the sons of God, made heirs of all the promises, and fellow-heirs with Christ in glory.
answer_zh: 答：（一）是神在祂独生子耶稣基督里，也是为了祂的缘故1 ，白白赐下的恩典2，由此，那些称义之人一概被纳入祂众子的数目3，归入祂的名下4；（二）祂又将祂儿子的灵赐给他们5，使他们得到父亲般的眷顾6，得享神儿女的自由和权益，承受各样的应许，并与基督在荣耀里同为后嗣7。
notes_en: Adoption grants believers the status and privileges of children. We are not only declared righteous but welcomed into God's family as His own children.
question: What is adoption?
answer: Adoption is an act of the free grace of God, in and for his only Son Jesus Christ, whereby all those that are justified are received into the number of his children, have his name put upon them, the Spirit of his Son given to them, are under his fatherly care and dispensations, admitted to all the liberties and privileges of the sons of God, made heirs of all the promises, and fellow-heirs with Christ in glory.

notes_zh: 成圣是渐进的过程，不同于称义的一次性宣告。信徒在今生不断地向罪死、向义活，越来越像基督。
question_zh: 问75：「成圣」是什么？
question_en: What is sanctification?
answer_en: Sanctification is a work of God's grace, whereby they whom God hath, before the foundation of the world, chosen to be holy, are in time, through the powerful operation of his Spirit applying the death and resurrection of Christ unto them, renewed in their whole man after the image of God; having the seeds of repentance unto life, and all other saving graces, put into their hearts, and those graces so stirred up, increased, and strengthened, as that they more and more die unto sin, and rise unto newness of life.
answer_zh: 答：（一）是神恩典的作为，由此，那些在创世前就蒙神拣选成为圣洁的人，在时候满足时，借着圣灵的大能大力1，把基督的死和复活应用到他们的身上2，按着神的形像使他们的全人得以更新3；（二）神也将悔改得生命的种子，以及其他所有救赎的恩惠，安置在他们的心中4，并且一直挑旺、增加、坚固这些恩典5，使他们愈来愈能向罪死，更有新生的样式6。
notes_en: Sanctification is a progressive work, unlike the once-for-all declaration of justification. Believers increasingly die to sin and live to righteousness, growing in Christlikeness.
question: What is sanctification?
answer: Sanctification is a work of God's grace, whereby they whom God hath, before the foundation of the world, chosen to be holy, are in time, through the powerful operation of his Spirit applying the death and resurrection of Christ unto them, renewed in their whole man after the image of God; having the seeds of repentance unto life, and all other saving graces, put into their hearts, and those graces so stirred up, increased, and strengthened, as that they more and more die unto sin, and rise unto newness of life.

notes_zh: 真正的悔改不仅是为罪的后果难过，更是因罪的本质而忧伤。它包含认罪、恨恶罪，并转向神过新的生活。
question_zh: 问76：「悔改得生命」是什么？
question_en: What is repentance unto life?
