answer_en: Repentance unto life is a saving grace, wrought in the heart of a sinner by the Spirit and Word of God, whereby, out of the sight and sense, not only of the danger, but also of the filthiness and odiousness of his sins, and upon the apprehension of God's mercy in Christ to such as are penitent, he so grieves for and hates his sins, as that he turns from them all to God, purposing and endeavoring constantly to walk with him in all the ways of new obedience.
answer_zh: 答：是救赎的恩典1，是圣灵2和神的道3在罪人心中做成的，罪人不但因此意识到罪的危险性4，也意识到罪的污秽和丑陋5，但他同时也领悟了神在基督里的怜悯6，因此为自己的罪忧伤痛悔7，并产生恨恶之情8，因而转离罪、完全归向神9，并定意、竭力以新的顺服，在各个方面与主同行10。
notes_en: True repentance grieves not only sin's consequences but sin's nature itself. It involves confession, hatred of sin, and turning to God in new obedience.
question: What is repentance unto life?
answer: Repentance unto life is a saving grace, wrought in the heart of a sinner by the Spirit and Word of God, whereby, out of the sight and sense, not only of the danger, but also of the filthiness and odiousness of his sins, and upon the apprehension of God's mercy in Christ to such as are penitent, he so grieves for and hates his sins, as that he turns from them all to God, purposing and endeavoring constantly to walk with him in all the ways of new obedience.

notes_zh: 称义是完全的法律宣告，成圣是渐进的内在更新。称义对所有信徒是完全相同的，成圣的程度则因人而异。
question_zh: 问77：称义与成圣有何不同？
question_en: Wherein do justification and sanctification differ?
answer_en: Although sanctification be inseparably joined with justification, yet they differ, in that God in justification imputeth the righteousness of Christ; in sanctification his Spirit infuseth grace, and enableth to the exercise thereof; in the former, sin is pardoned; in the other, it is subdued: the one doth equally free all believers from the revenging wrath of God, and that perfectly in this life, that they never fall into condemnation; the other is neither equal in all, nor in this life perfect in any, but growing up to perfection.
answer_zh: 答：虽然称义与成圣密不可分1，但它们仍有不同之处：（一）称义是神把基督的义归给我们2，而成圣则是祂的灵将恩典放在我们里面，使我们能以行出3。（二）称义使罪得赦免4，成圣使罪被制伏5。（三）称义使所有的信徒一概脱离神报应之怒，在今世就达于完全，使他们不再被定罪6；但成圣在所有的人身上并不都是相同的7，今世也没有任何人能达于完全8，而是向着完全不断长进9。
notes_en: Justification is a complete legal declaration; sanctification is progressive inner renewal. Justification is equal for all believers; sanctification varies in degree.

notes_zh: 信徒在今生始终面对内在的争战。即使最好的行为也有罪的掺杂。这使我们更加依靠基督的义。
question_zh: 问78：在成圣上，为何信徒不能达于完全呢？
question_en: Whence ariseth the imperfection of sanctification in believers?
answer_en: The imperfection of sanctification in believers ariseth from the remnants of sin abiding in every part of them, and the perpetual lustings of the flesh against the spirit; whereby they are often foiled with temptations, and fall into many sins, are hindered in all their spiritual services, and their best works are imperfect and defiled in the sight of God.
answer_zh: 答：（一）因为他们生命的每个部分都仍然还有罪的残馀，而肉体的情慾又常常与圣灵相争；（二）所以他们经常为试探所挫败，陷落到许多罪中1，使各种属灵的事奉受到拦阻2，即使是最好的善行，在神的眼中也不完美、仍有污损3。
notes_en: Believers face ongoing internal warfare in this life. Even their best works are tainted by sin, driving them to depend more fully on Christ's righteousness.
question: Whence ariseth the imperfection of sanctification in believers?
answer: The imperfection of sanctification in believers ariseth from the remnants of sin abiding in every part of them, and the perpetual lustings of the flesh against the spirit; whereby they are often foiled with temptations, and fall into many sins, are hindered in all their spiritual services, and their best works are imperfect and defiled in the sight of God.

notes_zh: 圣徒的恒忍不是靠信徒自己的力量，而是靠神的保守。真信徒可能跌倒，但不会最终堕落。
question_zh: 问79：真信徒既不完全，又常被诸般的试探和罪恶所胜，他们会不会因此从蒙恩的光景中堕落呢？
question_en: May not true believers, by reason of their imperfections, and the many temptations and sins they are overtaken with, fall away from the state of grace?
answer_en: True believers, by reason of the unchangeable love of God, and his decree and covenant to give them perseverance, their inseparable union with Christ, his continual intercession for them, and the Spirit and seed of God abiding in them, can neither totally nor finally fall away from the state of grace, but are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation.
answer_zh: 答：不会；因着神不变的爱1，和神按着祂的的元旨和圣约要赐给他们持守的力量（perseverance）2，使他们与基督密不可分地联合3，基督为他们持续不断的代求4，圣灵和神的种子住在他们心中5，所以，他们决不会从蒙恩的光景中堕落6，反而是因信蒙神大能的保守，终必得着到末世要显现的救恩7。
notes_en: The perseverance of the saints rests not on believers' strength but on God's keeping power. True believers may fall but will never fall away finally.

answer: True believers, by reason of the unchangeable love of God, and his decree and covenant to give them perseverance, their inseparable union with Christ, his continual intercession for them, and the Spirit and seed of God abiding in them, can neither totally nor finally fall away from the state of grace, but are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation.

notes_zh: 得救的确据不需要特殊的启示。信徒可以通过内在的见证和外在的果子，得到关于自己恩典状态的确据。
question_zh: 问80：真信徒是否能够毫无谬误地确知自己现在就是在蒙恩的光景中，并且因而持守（persevere），直到最终得救？
question_en: Can true believers be infallibly assured that they are in the estate of grace, and that they shall persevere therein unto salvation?
answer_en: Such as truly believe in Christ, and endeavor to walk in all good conscience before him, may, without extraordinary revelation, by faith grounded upon the truth of God's promises, and by the Spirit enabling them to discern in themselves those graces to which the promises of life are made, and bearing witness with their spirits that they are the children of God, be infallibly assured that they are in the estate of grace, and shall persevere therein unto salvation.
answer_zh: 答：是的；每个真正归信基督、而且竭力以无愧的良心行在祂面前的人1，不需要再有另外的奇特启示，只需要借着基于神应许之道的信心，借着圣灵（这圣灵使他们能够知道赐人生命之应许的恩典2，并与他们的灵同证他们是神的儿女3），他们就可以毫无谬误地确知他们已经蒙恩，并且因而持守，直到最终得救4。
notes_en: Assurance of salvation requires no special revelation. Believers can know their state of grace through internal witness and external fruit.

answer: Such as truly believe in Christ, and endeavor to walk in all good conscience before him, may, without extraordinary revelation, by faith grounded upon the truth of God's promises, and by the Spirit enabling them to discern in themselves those graces to which the promises of life are made, and bearing witness with their spirits that they are the children of God, be infallibly assured that they are in the estate of grace, and shall persevere therein unto salvation.

notes_zh: 确据不等于信心。信徒可能在信心的挣扎中缺乏确据，但神的灵始终保守他们不致完全绝望。
question_zh: 问81：是否所有的真信徒都能一直确知自己已经蒙恩，并可以得着至终所要显现的救恩？
question_en: Are all true believers at all times assured of their present being in the estate of grace, and that they shall be saved?
answer_en: Assurance of grace and salvation not being of the essence of faith, true believers may wait long before they obtain it; and, after the enjoyment thereof, may have it weakened and intermitted, through manifold distempers, sins, temptations, and desertions; yet are they never left without such a presence and support of the Spirit of God as keeps them from sinking into utter despair.
answer_zh: 答：确知自己蒙恩得救，并不是信心的本质1，在确知自己蒙恩得救之前，真信徒或许要长期等候一段时间2；而且即使在得着此一确知之后，此确知也会因着种种混乱、罪、试探而减弱或中断3；然而，圣灵的同在和扶持是决不会全然离开他们的，必保守他们不致陷入绝望4。
notes_en: Assurance is not the essence of faith. Believers may struggle without assurance, but God's Spirit always preserves them from utter despair.

notes_zh: 与基督在荣耀中的相通有三个阶段：今生已经开始，死后更为亲密，复活时完全实现。
question_zh: 问82：无形教会的成员在荣耀里所享有的「与基督相通」是什么？
question_en: What is the communion in glory which the members of the invisible church have with Christ?
answer_en: The communion in glory which the members of the invisible church have with Christ, is in this life, immediately after death, and at last perfected at the resurrection and day of judgment.
answer_zh: 答：在于今世1、死后2，以及最终在复活与审判之日达于完全的相通3。
notes_en: Communion in glory has three stages: begun in this life, deepened at death, and perfected at the resurrection.
question: What is the communion in glory which the members of the invisible church have with Christ?
answer: The communion in glory which the members of the invisible church have with Christ, is in this life, immediately after death, and at last perfected at the resurrection and day of judgment.

notes_zh: 信徒在今生已经品尝到将来荣耀的滋味。神的爱、平安、喜乐和盼望是天堂的预尝。
question_zh: 问83：在今世，无形教会的成员在荣耀里所享有的「与基督相通」是什么？
question_en: What is the communion in glory with Christ which the members of the invisible church enjoy in this life?
answer_en: The members of the invisible church have communicated to them in this life the firstfruits of glory with Christ, as they are members of him their head, and so in him are interested in that glory which he is fully possessed of; and, as an earnest thereof, enjoy the sense of God's love, peace of conscience, joy in the Holy Ghost, and hope of glory; as, on the contrary, sense of God's revenging wrath, horror of conscience, and a fearful expectation of judgment, are to the wicked the beginning of their torments which they shall endure after death.
answer_zh: 答：就是在今世的无形教会的成员与基督同得基督荣耀的初熟果子，因为他们是基督（他们的元首）的肢体，可以在祂里面享受祂所有的荣耀1；作为真诚的信徒，他们也享有神的慈爱2、良心的平安、圣灵中的喜乐，和荣耀的盼望3；但恶人则感受到神报仇的忿怒、良心的恐惧，对将来审判的惊惶，这些痛苦始于今世，并一直延续到死后4。
notes_en: Believers already taste future glory in this life. God's love, peace, joy, and hope are a foretaste of heaven.

notes_zh: 死亡是罪的结果，不是自然的安排。因为所有人都犯了罪，所以所有人都必须面对死亡。
question_zh: 问84：所有的人都会死吗？
question_en: Shall all men die?
answer_en: Death being threatened as the wages of sin, it is appointed unto all men once to die; for that all have sinned.
answer_zh: 答：死是罪的工价1，按着定命，人人都有一死2；因为所有的人都犯了罪3。
notes_en: Death is the consequence of sin, not a natural arrangement. Because all have sinned, all must face death.
question: Shall all men die?
answer: Death being threatened as the wages of sin, it is appointed unto all men once to die; for that all have sinned.

notes_zh: 对信徒来说，死亡已失去毒钩。它不再是刑罚，而是通往更深与基督相通的门户。
question_zh: 问85：虽然死是罪的工价，但义人的罪在基督里都已蒙赦免了，为什么他们还没有脱离死亡呢？
question_en: Death being the wages of sin, why are not the righteous delivered from death, seeing all their sins are forgiven in Christ?
answer_en: The righteous shall be delivered from death itself at the last day, and even in death are delivered from the sting and curse of it; so that, although they die, yet it is out of God's love, to free them perfectly from sin and misery, and to make them capable of further communion with Christ in glory, which they then enter upon.
answer_zh: 答：义人在末日的时候将脱离死亡，也脱离死亡的毒钩和咒诅1；因此，虽然他们也会死亡，但这是出于神的慈爱2，要使他们从罪恶和苦境中完全被释放出来3，如此他们便能够在即将进入的荣耀里，与基督有更深的相通4。
notes_en: For believers, death has lost its sting. It is no longer punishment but a gateway to deeper communion with Christ.
question: Death being the wages of sin, why are not the righteous delivered from death, seeing all their sins are forgiven in Christ?
answer: The righteous shall be delivered from death itself at the last day, and even in death are delivered from the sting and curse of it; so that, although they die, yet it is out of God's love, to free them perfectly from sin and misery, and to make them capable of further communion with Christ in glory, which they then enter upon.

notes_zh: 信徒死后立刻与基督同在——灵魂在圣洁中被成全。身体安息在坟墓中等候复活。
question_zh: 问86：在死后，无形教会的成员在荣耀里所享有的「与基督相通」是什么？
question_en: What is the communion in glory with Christ which the members of the invisible church enjoy immediately after death?
answer_en: The communion in glory with Christ which the members of the invisible church enjoy immediately after death, is, in that their souls are then made perfect in holiness, and received into the highest heavens, where they behold the face of God in light and glory, waiting for the full redemption of their bodies, which even in death continue united to Christ, and rest in their graves as in their beds, till at the last day they be again united to their souls. Whereas the souls of the wicked are at their death cast into hell, where they remain in torments and utter darkness, and their bodies kept in their graves, as in their prisons, till the resurrection and judgment of the great day.
answer_zh: 答：（一）那时，他们的灵魂在圣洁上达于完全1，被接入高天2，在光明和荣耀中得见神的面3；（二）他们也等候身体完全的得赎4，此时他们的身体即使在死亡中也与基督继续联合5，如同躺卧在床上般地安息在坟墓里 6，直到末日与他们的灵魂再次联合7。而恶人在死后，灵魂被抛进地狱里，停留在痛苦和彻底的黑暗之中；他们的身体则像被关在监狱中似地拘禁在坟墓里，直到复活和大日的审判8。
notes_en: Believers are immediately with Christ at death — their souls perfected in holiness. Their bodies rest in the grave awaiting resurrection.

answer: The communion in glory with Christ which the members of the invisible church enjoy immediately after death, is, in that their souls are then made perfect in holiness, and received into the highest heavens, where they behold the face of God in light and glory, waiting for the full redemption of their bodies, which even in death continue united to Christ, and rest in their graves as in their beds, till at the last day they be again united to their souls. notes_zh: 复活是真实的身体复活——同一的身体，但被改变。义人的身体将像基督荣耀的身体。
question_zh: 问87：关于复活，我们当信什么？
question_en: What are we to believe concerning the resurrection?
answer_en: We are to believe that at the last day there shall be a general resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust: when they that are then found alive shall in a moment be changed; and the selfsame bodies of the dead which were laid in the grave, being then again united to their souls forever, shall be raised up by the power of Christ. The bodies of the just, by the Spirit of Christ, and by virtue of his resurrection as their head, shall be raised in power, spiritual, incorruptible, and made like to his glorious body; and the bodies of the wicked shall be raised up in dishonor by him, as an offended judge.
answer_zh: 答：（一）在末日的时候，死人都要复活，无论义人或不义的人1：（二）那时，还活着的人在一刹那间都要改变，而那些躺在坟墓中的身体要与他们的灵魂重新联合，不再分离，因着基督的大能而复活2；（三）义人的身体，因着基督的灵，并借着他们的元首基督的复活，大有权能地复活，成为属灵的、不朽坏的，与基督荣耀的身体一样3。（四）而恶人的身体亦将由基督这位被触怒的审判者，使其在羞辱中复活过来4。
notes_en: The resurrection is a real bodily resurrection — the same body, but transformed. The bodies of the just will be like Christ's glorious body.
question: What are we to believe concerning the resurrection?
answer: We are to believe that at the last day there shall be a general resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust: when they that are then found alive shall in a moment be changed; and the selfsame bodies of the dead which were laid in the grave, being then again united to their souls forever, shall be raised up by the power of Christ. The bodies of the just, by the Spirit of Christ, and by virtue of his resurrection as their head, shall be raised in power, spiritual, incorruptible, and made like to his glorious body; and the bodies of the wicked shall be raised up in dishonor by him, as an offended judge.

notes_zh: 最后的审判将审判所有天使和人类。因为没有人知道确切的时间，我们应当时刻预备。
question_zh: 问88：复活之后，随即发生什么事？
question_en: What shall immediately follow after the resurrection?
answer_en: Immediately after the resurrection shall follow the general and final judgment of angels and men; the day and hour whereof no man knoweth, that all may watch and pray, and be ever ready for the coming of the Lord.
answer_zh: 答：随即会对天使和世人有一个全面的、最终的大审判1；没有人知道那日子、那时辰，致使所有的人都可儆醒、祷告，时刻预备主的到来2。
notes_en: The final judgment will judge all angels and humans. Since no one knows the exact time, we must always be ready.
question: What shall immediately follow after the resurrection?
answer: Immediately after the resurrection shall follow the general and final judgment of angels and men; the day and hour whereof no man knoweth, that all may watch and pray, and be ever ready for the coming of the Lord.

notes_zh: 最后的审判对恶人是完全公义的。他们自己的良心也会见证神判决的正确。
question_zh: 问89：当审判之日，恶人所要承受的是什么？
question_en: What shall be done to the wicked at the day of judgment?
answer_en: At the day of judgment, the wicked shall be set on Christ's left hand, and, upon clear evidence, and full conviction of their own consciences, shall have the fearful but just sentence of condemnation pronounced against them; and thereupon shall be cast out from the favorable presence of God, and the glorious fellowship with Christ, his saints, and all his holy angels, into hell, to be punished with unspeakable torments, both of body and soul, with the devil and his angels forever.
answer_zh: 答：（一）当审判之日，恶人将会被置于基督的左边1，基于确凿的证据，和他们自己完全伏罪的良知2，就被公开定罪，承受可怕但却公平的判决3；（二）随即被抛进地狱里，脱离神恩惠的同在，也脱离与基督、祂的圣徒，和所有圣天使的荣耀团契，他们的身体、灵魂都要遭受那无法言喻之痛苦的刑罚，与魔鬼和属牠的天使在一起，直到永永远远4。
notes_en: The final judgment of the wicked is entirely just. Their own consciences will testify to the fairness of God's verdict.
question: What shall be done to the wicked at the day of judgment?
answer: At the day of judgment, the wicked shall be set on Christ's left hand, and, upon clear evidence, and full conviction of their own consciences, shall have the fearful but just sentence of condemnation pronounced against them; and thereupon shall be cast out from the favorable presence of God, and the glorious fellowship with Christ, his saints, and all his holy angels, into hell, to be punished with unspeakable torments, both of body and soul, with the devil and his angels forever.

notes_zh: 这是信徒最终和完全的盼望：与神面对面，永远享受祂的同在，身体和灵魂都完全。
question_zh: 问90：当审判之日，义人所要承受的是什么？
question_en: What shall be done to the righteous at the day of judgment?
answer_en: At the day of judgment, the righteous, being caught up to Christ in the clouds, shall be set on his right hand, and there openly acknowledged and acquitted, shall join with him in the judging of reprobate angels and men, and shall be received into heaven, where they shall be fully and forever freed from all sin and misery; filled with inconceivable joys, made perfectly holy and happy both in body and soul, in the company of innumerable saints and holy angels, but especially in the immediate vision and fruition of God the Father, of our Lord Jesus Christ, and of the Holy Spirit, to all eternity. And this is the perfect and full communion which the members of the invisible church shall enjoy with Christ in glory, at the resurrection and day of judgment. HAVING SEEN WHAT THE SCRIPTURES PRINCIPALLY TEACH US TO BELIEVE CONCERNING GOD, IT FOLLOWS TO CONSIDER WHAT THEY REQUIRE AS THE DUTY OF MAN
answer_zh: 答：（一）当审判之日，义人被提到云里1，与基督同在，坐在祂的右边，当众被主承认、判为无罪2，并与基督一同审判被遗弃的天使和世人3；（二）义人要被接入天堂4，完全地、永远地脱离一切的罪恶和苦境5，被无法想像的喜乐所充满6，在身体和灵魂上都达于完全的圣洁和幸福，与无数的圣徒和圣天使在一起7，特别是直接得见父神、主耶稣基督和圣灵，以此为乐，直到永远8。（三）这就是无形教会的成员，当复活和审判之日，在荣耀里与基督所享有的完美相通。
notes_en: This is the believer's ultimate hope: face-to-face with God, forever enjoying His presence, perfected in body and soul.
question: What shall be done to the righteous at the day of judgment?
answer: At the day of judgment, the righteous, being caught up to Christ in the clouds, shall be set on his right hand, and there openly acknowledged and acquitted, shall join with him in the judging of reprobate angels and men, and shall be received into heaven, where they shall be fully and forever freed from all sin and misery; filled with inconceivable joys, made perfectly holy and happy both in body and soul, in the company of innumerable saints and holy angels, but especially in the immediate vision and fruition of God the Father, of our Lord Jesus Christ, and of the Holy Spirit, to all eternity. And this is the perfect and full communion which the members of the invisible church shall enjoy with Christ in glory, at the resurrection and day of judgment. notes_zh: 要理问答在此转向第二大部分：人当尽的本分。顺服不是得救的条件，而是得救的果子。
question_zh: 问91：神要人尽什么本分？
question_en: What is the duty which God requireth of man?
answer_en: The duty which God requireth of man, is obedience to his revealed will.
answer_zh: 答：神要人所尽的本分是：顺服祂已经显明的旨意1。
notes_en: The catechism here turns to the second major section: human duty. Obedience is not the condition of salvation but its fruit.
question: What is the duty which God requireth of man?
answer: The duty which God requireth of man, is obedience to his revealed will.

notes_zh: 道德律从创造之初就刻在人心中。十诫是这道德律的总结和明确表达。
question_zh: 问92：神起初向人显明什么旨意要人顺服？
question_en: What did God first reveal unto man as the rule of his obedience?
answer_en: The rule of obedience revealed to Adam in the estate of innocence, and to all mankind in him, besides a special command not to eat of the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, was the moral law.
answer_zh: 答：亚当在无罪状态时，神向他、和在他里面的全人类，除了显明「不可吃分别善恶树上的果子」这个特别的诫命之外，还要人遵守道德律1。

question_zh: 问93：道德律是什么？
question_en: What is the moral law?
answer_en: The moral law is the declaration of the will of God to mankind, directing and binding every one to personal, perfect, and perpetual conformity and obedience thereunto, in the frame and disposition of the whole man, soul, and body, and in performance of all those duties of holiness and righteousness which he oweth to God and man: promising life upon the fulfilling, and threatening death upon the breach of it.
answer_zh: 答：道德律是神宣告祂对人类旨意的内容。这道德律指挥并约束每个人各别、完全、持续地将全人身心献上，使他顺服这道德律 1，行出一切他向神和世人当尽的本分，就是圣洁与公义2。人若遵行它，神应许他必得生；人若违背它，神警告他必要死3。

question_zh: 问94：堕落之后，道德律对人还有用吗？
question_en: Is there any use of the moral law since the fall?
answer_en: Although no man, since the fall, can attain to righteousness and life by the moral law; yet there is great use thereof, as well common to all men, as peculiar either to the unregenerate, or the regenerate.
answer_zh: 答：堕落之后，没有人能靠道德律得到公义和生命1；但道德律仍然大有用处，而且对所有的人都有用；不管是未重生的人，还是已重生的人，都是如此2。

question_zh: 问95：道德律对所有的人有什么用处？
question_en: Of what use is the moral law to all men?
answer_en: The moral law is of use to all men, to inform them of the holy nature and will of God, and of their duty, binding them to walk accordingly; to convince them of their disability to keep it, and of the sinful pollution of their nature, hearts, and lives: to humble them in the sense of their sin and misery, and thereby help them to a clearer sight of the need they have of Christ, and of the perfection of his obedience.
answer_zh: 答：（一）让人知道神圣洁的属性和旨意1，也知道自己有责任要遵行2；（二）让人确信自己没有能力遵行，也确信自己的性情、心灵和生命都被罪玷污3；（三）让人因为体会自己有罪而痛苦，以致愿意谦卑下来4，由此帮助他们更清楚体认自己需要基督5，也需要完全顺服基督6。
notes_en: The moral law is like a mirror showing all people God's standard and their shortcomings, pointing them to Christ.

question_en: What particular use is there of the moral law to unregenerate men?

question_en: What special use is there of the moral law to the regenerate?
answer_en: Although they that are regenerate, and believe in Christ, be delivered from the moral law as a covenant of works, so as thereby they are neither justified nor condemned; yet besides the general uses thereof common to them with all men, it is of special use, to show them how much they are bound to Christ for his fulfilling it, and enduring the curse thereof in their stead, and for their good; and thereby to provoke them to more thankfulness, and to express the same in their greater care to conform themselves thereunto as the rule of their obedience.

question_en: Where is the moral law summarily comprehended?
answer_en: The moral law is summarily comprehended in the Ten Commandments, which were delivered by the voice of God upon mount Sinai, and written by him in two tables of stone; and are recorded in the twentieth chapter of Exodus; the four first commandments containing our duty to God, and the other six our duty to man.

question_zh: 问99：我们要遵循什么原则，才不会误解十诫？
question_en: What rules are to be observed for the right understanding of the Ten Commandments?
answer_en: For the right understanding of the Ten Commandments, these rules are to be observed: 1. That the law is perfect, and bindeth every one to full conformity in the whole man unto the righteousness thereof, and unto entire obedience forever; so as to require the utmost perfection of every duty, and to forbid the least degree of every sin. 2. That it is spiritual, and so reacheth the understanding, will, affections, and all other powers of the soul; as well as words, works, and gestures. 3. That one and the same thing, in divers respects, is required or forbidden in several commandments. 4. That as, where a duty is commanded, the contrary sin is forbidden; and, where a sin is forbidden, the contrary duty is commanded: so, where a promise is annexed, the contrary threatening is included; and, where a threatening is annexed, the contrary promise is included. 5. That what God forbids, is at no time to be done; what he commands, is always our duty; and yet every particular duty is not to be done at all times. 6. That under one sin or duty, all of the same kind are forbidden or commanded; together with all the causes, means, occasions, and appearances thereof, and provocations thereunto. 7. That what is forbidden or commanded to ourselves, we are bound, according to our places, to endeavor that it may be avoided or performed by others, according to the duty of their places. 8. That in what is commanded to others, we are bound, according to our places and callings, to be helpful to them; and to take heed of partaking with others in what is forbidden them.
answer_zh: 答：要遵循下列原则：（一） 律法是全备的，每个人都要全人全心、完全遵行其义理，而且要完全顺服，直到永远；因此，每一项责任都要以最完全的标准履行，每一项罪恶都要以最严格的标准禁止1。
notes_en: These eight rules are keys to understanding the commandments. Each commandment's meaning extends far beyond its literal wording, encompassing both positive and negative requirements.

question_zh: 问101：十诫的序言是什么？
question_en: What is the preface to the Ten Commandments?
answer_en: The preface to the Ten Commandments is contained in these words, I am the LORD thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage. Wherein God manifesteth his sovereignty, as being JEHOVAH, the eternal, immutable, and almighty God; having his being in and of himself, and giving being to all his words and works: and that he is a God in covenant, as with Israel of old, so with all his people; who, as he brought them out of their bondage in Egypt, so he delivereth us from our spiritual thraldom; and that therefore we are bound to take him for our God alone, and to keep all his commandments.
answer_zh: 答：十诫的序言是：「我是耶和华——你的神，曾将你从埃及地为奴之家领出来1」。神在这段序言里显明祂的主权──祂是耶和华，是永恒、不变、全能的神2，祂的本质自有永有3，又以祂的话语4和作为5彰显这本质：祂是立约的神，过去怎样与以色列人立约，现在也照样与祂每位子民立约6；祂怎样带领他们摆脱埃及的捆绑，也照样把我们从属灵的辖制里释放出来7；所以我们当然应该认为祂是我们独一的神，并且遵行祂一切的诫命8。

question_zh: 问105：第一诫禁止什么罪？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the first commandment?
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the first commandment, are, atheism, in denying or not having a God; idolatry, in having or worshiping more gods than one, or any with or instead of the true God; the not having and avouching him for God, and our God; the omission or neglect of anything due to him, required in this commandment; ignorance, forgetfulness, misapprehensions, false opinions, unworthy and wicked thoughts of him; bold and curious searching into his secrets; all profaneness, hatred of God; self-love, self-seeking, and all other inordinate and immoderate setting of our mind, will, or affections upon other things, and taking them off from him in whole or in part; vain credulity, unbelief, heresy, misbelief, distrust, despair, incorrigibleness, and insensibleness under judgments, hardness of heart, pride, presumption, carnal security, tempting of God; using unlawful means, and trusting in lawful means; carnal delights and joys; corrupt, blind, and indiscreet zeal; lukewarmness, and deadness in the things of God; estranging ourselves, and apostatizing from God; praying, or giving any religious worship, to saints, angels, or any other creatures; all compacts and consulting with the devil, and hearkening to his suggestions; making men the lords of our faith and conscience; slighting and despising God and his commands; resisting and grieving of his Spirit, discontent and impatience at his dispensations, charging him foolishly for the evils he inflicts on us; and ascribing the praise of any good we either are, have, or can do, to fortune, idols, ourselves, or any other creature.

question_zh: 问106：第一诫说：「在我面前」，这对我们有什么特别的教导？（请参考问103编按）

question_zh: 问107：第二诫是什么？
question_en: Which is the second commandment?
answer_en: The second commandment is, Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth. answer_zh: 答：第二条诫是：「不可为自己雕刻偶像，也不可做什么形像彷彿上天、下地，和地底下、水中的百物。不可跪拜那些像，也不可事奉它，因为我耶和华──你的神是忌邪的神。恨我的，我必追讨他的罪，自父及子，直到三、四代；爱我、守我诫命的，我必向他们发慈爱，直到千代」1。

question_zh: 问108：第二诫吩咐我们尽什么责任？
question_en: What are the duties required in the second commandment?
answer_en: The duties required in the second commandment are, the receiving, observing, and keeping pure and entire, all such religious worship and ordinances as God hath instituted in his word; particularly prayer and thanksgiving in the name of Christ; the reading, preaching, and hearing of the word; the administration and receiving of the sacraments; church government and discipline; the ministry and maintenance thereof; religious fasting; swearing by the name of God, and vowing unto him: as also the disapproving, detesting, opposing, all false worship; and, according to each one's place and calling, removing it, and all monuments of idolatry.
answer_zh: 答：第二诫吩咐我们要尽的责任是：对神在圣经中所指定的宗教崇拜和典章，要接受遵行，保持纯全1；特别是奉基督之名的祷告和感恩2；读经、传道、听道3；施行和接受圣礼4；教会治理和惩戒5；教会服事与维护6；宗教性禁食7；奉神的名宣誓8，向神许愿9：以及谴责、痛恨、反对各样的伪崇拜10；并根据自己的处境和呼召，清除伪崇拜，以及偶像崇拜的各种标记11。

question_zh: 问109：第二诫禁止什么罪行？
question_en: What sins are forbidden in the second commandment?
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the second commandment are, all devising, counseling, commanding, using, and any wise approving, any religious worship not instituted by God himself; the making any representation of God, of all or of any of the three persons, either inwardly in our mind, or outwardly in any kind of image or likeness of any creature whatsoever; all worshiping of it, or God in it or by it; the making of any representation of feigned deities, and all worship of them, or service belonging to them; all superstitious devices, corrupting the worship of God, adding to it, or taking from it, whether invented and taken up of ourselves, or received by tradition from others, though under the title of antiquity, custom, devotion, good intent, or any other pretense whatsoever; simony; sacrilege; all neglect, contempt, hindering, and opposing the worship and ordinances which God hath appointed.
answer_zh: 答：（一）以各种方式发明1、提议2、命令3、使用4、认可任何不是神设立的宗教崇拜5；宽容伪宗教6；（二）或于自己心中，或于外在世界，或以任何受造物的形像和样式，制造神的三个位格或任何一个位格的像7；崇拜这像8，或者崇拜其中的神，或者借着它崇拜神9；（三）制造假神的像10，并且崇拜、事奉它11；（四）以古风12、习俗13、敬虔14、好意，或其他借口15、或凭自己杜撰、或由自己发起16、或因别人的传统17，设计各种迷信18，在崇拜的事上或加添、或删减19，败坏对神的崇拜20；（五）买卖圣职21；亵渎神22；忽略23、轻蔑24、拦阻25、抵挡神所指定的敬拜和典章26。

question_zh: 问110：第二诫附加什么理由要我们遵行？
question_en: What are the reasons annexed to the second commandment, the more to enforce it?
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the second commandment, the more to enforce it, contained in these words, For I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me; and shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments; are, besides God's sovereignty over us, and propriety in us, his fervent zeal for his own worship, and his revengeful indignation against all false worship, as being a spiritual whoredom; accounting the breakers of this commandment such as hate him, and threatening to punish them unto divers generations; and esteeming the observers of it such as love him and keep his commandments, and promising mercy to them unto many generations.

question_zh: 问113：第三诫禁止什么罪行？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the third commandment?
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the third commandment are, the not using of God's name as is required; and the abuse of it in an ignorant, vain, irreverent, profane, superstitious, or wicked mentioning or otherwise using his titles, attributes, ordinances, or works, by blasphemy, perjury; all sinful cursings, oaths, vows, and lots; violating of our oaths and vows, if lawful; and fulfilling them, if of things unlawful; murmuring and quarreling at, curious prying into, and misapplying of God's decrees and providences; misinterpreting, misapplying, or any way perverting the word, or any part of it, to profane jests, curious or unprofitable questions, vain janglings, or the maintaining of false doctrines; abusing it, the creatures, or anything contained under the name of God, to charms, or sinful lusts and practices; the maligning, scorning, reviling, or any wise opposing of God's truth, grace, and ways; making profession of religion in hypocrisy, or for sinister ends; being ashamed of it, or a shame to it, by unconformable, unwise, unfruitful, and offensive walking, or backsliding from it.
answer_zh: 答：（一）当神要求我们使用祂名字时，却不使用神的名字1；或是当我们不该使用祂名字时，却以愚昧2、虚妄3、不敬、亵渎4、迷信5或邪恶的态度，提起或使用神的名号、属性6、律例7、作为8；或是因为亵渎9、伪证10而滥用神的名字；（二）一切恶毒的咒诅11、起誓12、许愿13、掣籤14；（三）起合法的誓却不履行，许合法的愿却不还愿15；起不合法的誓却履行，许不合法的愿却还愿16；（四）抱怨、抗拒17、窥探18、误用神的元旨19和护理20；（五）误解21、误用22，或以其他方式歪曲神的圣言，或这圣言的任何部分23，将这圣言用于亵渎的戏谑24、好奇而无益的问难、荒渺无凭的空谈，或坚持谬妄的教义25；（六）滥用神的圣言、受造物，或神名下所包含的任何事物，将它们用于魔法符咒26、邪恶的情慾和行为27；（七）恶毒中伤28，亵慢讥诮29，肆意谩骂30，或其他任何抵挡神的真理、恩典、道路的行为31；（八）假冒为善、谎称信主以图谋不轨32；（九）以主名为耻33；（十）因为不顺从34、无智慧35、不结果子36、绊倒人37、背道38而使主名蒙羞。

question_zh: 问114：第三诫附加什么理由要我们遵行？
question_en: What reasons are annexed to the third commandment?
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the third commandment, in these words, The LORD thy God , and, For the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain , are, because he is the Lord and our God, therefore his name is not to be profaned, or any way abused by us; especially because he will be so far from acquitting and sparing the transgressors of this commandment, as that he will not suffer them to escape his righteous judgment, albeit many such escape the censures and punishments of men.

question_zh: 问116：第四诫吩咐什么？
question_en: What is required in the fourth commandment?

question_zh: 问117：如何将安息日或主日守为圣日？
question_en: How is the sabbath or the Lord's day to be sanctified?
answer_en: The sabbath or Lord's day is to be sanctified by an holy resting all the day, not only from such works as are at all times sinful, but even from such worldly employments and recreations as are on other days lawful; and making it our delight to spend the whole time (except so much of it as is to be taken up in works of necessity and mercy) in the public and private exercises of God's worship: and, to that end, we are to prepare our hearts, and with such foresight, diligence, and moderation, to dispose and seasonably dispatch our worldly business, that we may be the more free and fit for the duties of that day.
answer_zh: 答：守安息日为圣日，乃是整日都有圣洁的安息1，不仅停止那些平常就被算为有罪的恶事，还要停止平日合法的属世职业和娱乐2；并用全部时间或与众人或在家中，敬拜神3，以此为乐；除非有特别需要，或是行慈善怜悯，才可例外4。因此我们要预备心灵、提前安排、殷勤做工、稳健节制、合乎时宜、迅速处理我们的世俗之事，使我们可以更自由、更合宜地尽这日当尽的本分5。

question_zh: 问118：为什么守安息日的吩咐特别针对家长、长辈（或位分大的）？

notes_zh: 大要理问答第120题
question_zh: 问120：第四诫附加什么理由，不但要我们遵行，甚至要我们立为规矩，让别人也遵行？
question_en: What are the reasons annexed to the fourth commandment, the more to enforce it?
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the fourth commandment, the more to enforce it, are taken from the equity of it, God allowing us six days of seven for our own affairs, and reserving but one for himself, in these words, Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work: from God's challenging a special propriety in that day, The seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: from the example of God, who in six days ... made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: and from that blessing which God put upon that day, not only in sanctifying it to be a day for his service, but in ordaining it to be a means of blessing to us in our sanctifying it; Wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
answer_zh: 答：第四诫不但要我们遵行，甚至要我们立为规矩，让别人也遵行，附加的理由在于这诫表现的公平原则：神让我们一周有六日做自己的工，保留一日归祂自己：「六日要劳碌做你一切的工」1；神向我们发出一个挑战，要我们把这日特别归祂：「第七日是向耶和华──你神当守的安息日」2；而且神以身作则：「六日之内，耶和华造天、地、海，和其中的万物，第七日便安息」；神特别祝福此日，不仅把这日分别为圣，用于事奉祂，而且指定，当我们守此日为圣的时候，此日便成为我们蒙福的器皿：「所以耶和华赐福与安息日，定为圣日」3。

question_zh: 问121：为什么第四诫一开始就用「记念」一词？
question_en: Why is the word Remember set in the beginning of the fourth commandment?
answer_en: The word Remember is set in the beginning of the fourth commandment, partly, because of the great benefit of remembering it, we being thereby helped in our preparation to keep it, and, in keeping it, better to keep all the rest of the commandments, and to continue a thankful remembrance of the two great benefits of creation and redemption, which contain a short abridgment of religion; and partly, because we are very ready to forget it, for that there is less light of nature for it, and yet it restraineth our natural liberty in things at other times lawful; that it cometh but once in seven days, and many worldly businesses come between, and too often take off our minds from thinking of it, either to prepare for it, or to sanctify it; and that Satan with his instruments much labor to blot out the glory, and even the memory of it, to bring in all irreligion and impiety.
answer_zh: 答：第四诫一开始就用「记念」一词1，有几个原因：（一）记念这日对我们很有好处，我们预备遵守，可以从中得帮助 2。我们在遵守这诫时，最好也同时遵行其他每个诫命3，不断以感恩的心记念「创造」与「救赎」这两个信仰的总结4；（二）我们容易忘记这日5，因为天然的光很少反映这事6，而且守安息日限制了我们天然的自由，平日合法的事情这日却不能行7；安息日七天才有一天，其间世务繁多，使我们的心思意念无暇顾及这日，更甭说提前预备，守为圣日了8；再者，撒但和牠的仆役也是辛苦做工，妄图抹掉这日的荣耀，甚至想把这日从人的记忆中完全抹除，以便塞进各种各样反宗教、不敬虔之事9。
question: Why is the word Remember set in the beginning of the fourth commandment?
answer: The word Remember is set in the beginning of the fourth commandment, partly, because of the great benefit of remembering it, we being thereby helped in our preparation to keep it, and, in keeping it, better to keep all the rest of the commandments, and to continue a thankful remembrance of the two great benefits of creation and redemption, which contain a short abridgment of religion; and partly, because we are very ready to forget it, for that there is less light of nature for it, and yet it restraineth our natural liberty in things at other times lawful; that it cometh but once in seven days, and many worldly businesses come between, and too often take off our minds from thinking of it, either to prepare for it, or to sanctify it; and that Satan with his instruments much labor to blot out the glory, and even the memory of it, to bring in all irreligion and impiety.

notes_zh: 大要理问答第125题
question_zh: 问125：为什么称长辈（或位分大的）为父母？
question_en: Why are superiors styled Father and Mother?
answer_en: Superiors are styled Father and Mother , both to teach them in all duties toward their inferiors, like natural parents, to express love and tenderness to them, according to their several relations; and to work inferiors to a greater willingness and cheerfulness in performing their duties to their superiors, as to their parents.

notes_zh: 大要理问答第127题
question_zh: 问127：晚辈（或位分小的）应该怎样尊敬长辈（或位分大的）？
question_en: What is the honor that inferiors owe to their superiors?
answer_en: The honor which inferiors owe to their superiors is, all due reverence in heart, word, and behavior; prayer and thanksgiving for them; imitation of their virtues and graces; willing obedience to their lawful commands and counsels; due submission to their corrections; fidelity to, defense, and maintenance of their persons and authority, according to their several ranks, and the nature of their places; bearing with their infirmities, and covering them in love, that so they may be an honor to them and to their government.
answer_zh: 答：晚辈（或位分小的）应该在心思1、言语2和行为3上，以合宜的态度尊敬长辈（或位分大的）；为他们祷告、祝谢4；效法他们的德行、恩惠5；甘心顺服他们合法的吩咐和建议6；他们对我们的责备，该顺服的就顺服7；我们应该按照他们的身分地位8，忠于9、保卫10、维护他们的人格和权威；担当他们的软弱，以爱心遮盖他们11，这样就可以使他们和他们的官长引以为荣12。

notes_zh: 大要理问答第128题
question_zh: 问128：晚辈（或位分小的）对长辈（或位分大的）犯的罪是什么？
question_en: What are the sins of inferiors against their superiors?
answer_en: The sins of inferiors against their superiors are, all neglect of the duties required toward them; envying at, contempt of, and rebellion against their persons and places, in their lawful counsels, commands, and corrections; cursing, mocking, and all such refractory and scandalous carriage, as proves a shame and dishonor to them and their government.

notes_zh: 大要理问答第129题
question_zh: 问129：长辈（或位分大的）对晚辈（或位分小的）应尽什么责任？
question_en: What is required of superiors towards their inferiors?
answer_en: It is required of superiors, according to that power they receive from God, and that relation wherein they stand, to love, pray for, and bless their inferiors; to instruct, counsel, and admonish them; countenancing, commending, and rewarding such as do well; and discountenancing, reproving, and chastising such as do ill; protecting, and providing for them all things necessary for soul and body: and by grave, wise, holy, and exemplary carriage, to procure glory to God, honor to themselves, and so to preserve that authority which God hath put upon them.

notes_zh: 大要理问答第130题
question_zh: 问130：长辈（或位分大的）容易犯什么罪？
question_en: What are the sins of superiors?
answer_en: The sins of superiors are, besides the neglect of the duties required of them, an inordinate seeking of themselves, their own glory, ease, profit, or pleasure; commanding things unlawful, or not in the power of inferiors to perform; counseling, encouraging, or favoring them in that which is evil; dissuading, discouraging, or discountenancing them in that which is good; correcting them unduly; careless exposing, or leaving them to wrong, temptation, and danger; provoking them to wrath; or any way dishonoring themselves, or lessening their authority, by an unjust, indiscreet, rigorous, or remiss behavior.
answer_zh: 答：（一）忽略当尽的责任1，专求自己的事2，求自己的荣耀3、舒适、好处和快乐4；（二）要求晚辈（或位分小的）行非法的事5，或他们能力范围以外的事6；（三）对恶事，出谋策划7、怂恿促进8、偏袒9；（四）对善事，横加拦阻、打击士气、不鼓励10；（五）责备不当11；粗心大意，把晚辈（或位分小的）置于谬误、疑惑和危险而不顾12；激怒他们13；（六）任何因着不公义、不慎重、为人苛刻、疏忽职责的事，使自己蒙羞、自己的权威受损14。

notes_zh: 大要理问答第135题
question_zh: 问135：第六诫吩咐我们尽什么责任？
question_en: What are the duties required in the sixth commandment?
answer_en: The duties required in the sixth commandment are, all careful studies, and lawful endeavors, to preserve the life of ourselves and others by resisting all thoughts and purposes, subduing all passions, and avoiding all occasions, temptations, and practices, which tend to the unjust taking away the life of any; by just defense thereof against violence, patient bearing of the hand of God, quietness of mind, cheerfulness of spirit; a sober use of meat, drink, physic, sleep, labor, and recreations; by charitable thoughts, love, compassion, meekness, gentleness, kindness; peaceable, mild and courteous speeches and behavior; forbearance, readiness to be reconciled, patient bearing and forgiving of injuries, and requiting good for evil; comforting and succoring the distressed, and protecting and defending the innocent.
answer_zh: 答：（一）用各种方式仔细研究，也尽力用一切合法手段，保守我们自己1和别人2的生命，抵挡各种思想意图3，制伏一切情绪4，避免一切可能以不正当方式夺取任何人生命5的场合6、试探7和行为；（二）以正当方式抵御暴力8，耐心接受神的作为9，内心安静10、心中喜乐11；适度吃肉12，饮酒13，服药14，睡眠15，劳动16，娱乐17；（三）有恩惠18，有爱心19，怜悯20，谦虚，温柔，仁慈21；（四）言语行为，温良柔顺22，谦恭有节，寻求和睦23；（五）凡事克制，乐意和好，恒久忍耐，饶恕伤害，以善报恶24；（六）安慰、救助受苦的人，保守、护卫无辜的人25。
question: What are the duties required in the sixth commandment?

notes_zh: 大要理问答第136题
question_zh: 问136：第六诫禁止什么罪行？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the sixth commandment?
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the sixth commandment are, all taking away the life of ourselves, or of others, except in case of public justice, lawful war, or necessary defense; the neglecting or withdrawing the lawful and necessary means of preservation of life; sinful anger, hatred, envy, desire of revenge; all excessive passions, distracting cares; immoderate use of meat, drink, labor, and recreations; provoking words, oppression, quarreling, striking, wounding, and whatsoever else tends to the destruction of the life of any.
answer_zh: 答：（一）以各种形式夺去我们1和别人2生命的行为，除非在公共司法3、合法战争4，或正当防卫的情况5；（二）忽略合法的必要手段保守生命，或故意不用合法的必要手段保守生命6；（三）生气以致犯罪7、仇恨8、嫉妒9、复仇的欲望10；（四）一切过分的情绪11、使人烦乱的忧虑12；无节制的吃肉、饮酒13、劳苦14、娱乐15；（五）触动怒气的言语16、苦待别人17、纷扰争竞18、击打伤害19，以及任何倾向于毁坏人生命的行为20。

question_zh: 问138：第七诫吩咐我们尽什么责任？
question_en: What are the duties required in the seventh commandment?

notes_zh: 大要理问答第139题
question_zh: 问139：第七诫禁止什么罪行？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the seventh commandment?
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the seventh commandment, besides the neglect of the duties required, are, adultery, fornication, rape, incest, sodomy, and all unnatural lusts; all unclean imaginations, thoughts, purposes, and affections; all corrupt or filthy communications, or listening thereunto; wanton looks, impudent or light behavior, immodest apparel; prohibiting of lawful, and dispensing with unlawful marriages; allowing, tolerating, keeping of stews, and resorting to them; entangling vows of single life, undue delay of marriage; having more wives or husbands than one at the same time; unjust divorce, or desertion; idleness, gluttony, drunkenness, unchaste company; lascivious songs, books, pictures, dancings, stage plays; and all other provocations to, or acts of uncleanness, either in ourselves or others.

answer_zh: 答：神要我们向祂悔改，信靠耶稣基督1；基督也使用一些外在管道，使我们得着祂这位中保成就的救赎恩典，这些外在管道我们要勤加使用2，才可以逃避祂的烈怒和咒诅。

answer: That we may escape the wrath and curse of God due to us by reason of the transgression of the law, he requireth of us repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ, and the diligent use of the outward means whereby Christ communicates to us the benefits of his mediation.

notes_zh: 蒙恩之道是神所设立的管道，圣灵借此将基督的救赎应用在信徒身上。我们当珍惜并忠心使用这些恩典管道。
question_zh: 问154：基督使用哪些外在管道，使我们得着祂这位中保成就的救赎恩典？
question_en: What are the outward means whereby Christ communicates to us the benefits of his mediation?
answer_en: The outward and ordinary means whereby Christ communicates to his church the benefits of his mediation, are all his ordinances; especially the word, sacraments, and prayer; all which are made effectual to the elect for their salvation.
answer_zh: 答：基督使用的外在一般管道是：祂一切的诫命，特别是圣经、圣礼和祷告；这些都对选民发生功效，使他们得救1。
question: What are the outward means whereby Christ communicates to us the benefits of his mediation?
answer: The outward and ordinary means whereby Christ communicates to his church the benefits of his mediation, are all his ordinances; especially the word, sacraments, and prayer; all which are made effectual to the elect for their salvation.

notes_zh: 神的话语本身带着能力，但需要圣灵的内在工作才能使之在人心中产生果效。讲道因此是教会最重要的事工之一。
question_zh: 问155：圣经怎样发生功效，使人得救？
question_en: How is the word made effectual to salvation?
answer_en: The Spirit of God maketh the reading, but especially the preaching of the word, an effectual means of enlightening, convincing, and humbling sinners; of driving them out of themselves, and drawing them unto Christ; of conforming them to his image, and subduing them to his will; of strengthening them against temptations and corruptions; of building them up in grace, and establishing their hearts in holiness and comfort through faith unto salvation.
answer_zh: 答：当人阅读圣经、传讲圣经时，圣灵就使圣经发生功效（二者相比，传讲圣经的功效更大），开启罪人1、使他们（一）知罪而谦卑2；（二）脱离自我，归向基督3；（三）合乎祂的形状4，顺服祂的旨意5；（四）得坚固，可以抵挡各样的试探和败坏6；（五）在恩典中得建造7，因信而使心里圣洁，得着安慰，以致得救8。
question: How is the word made effectual to salvation?
answer: The Spirit of God maketh the reading, but especially the preaching of the word, an effectual means of enlightening, convincing, and humbling sinners; of driving them out of themselves, and drawing them unto Christ; of conforming them to his image, and subduing them to his will; of strengthening them against temptations and corruptions; of building them up in grace, and establishing their hearts in holiness and comfort through faith unto salvation.

notes_zh: 公开宣读圣经是特定职分的责任，但每位信徒都有责任个人读经、研经，好认识神的心意。
question_zh: 问156：圣经是否应该被众人诵读？
question_en: Is the Word of God to be read by all?
answer_en: Although all are not to be permitted to read the word publicly to the congregation, yet all sorts of people are bound to read it apart by themselves, and with their families: to which end, the holy Scriptures are to be translated out of the original into vulgar languages.
answer_zh: 答：虽然不是每个人都可以公开在聚会中向会众诵读圣经1，但是每个人都应该在私下场合自己阅读圣经2，并与自己的家人一同读经3；为了这个缘故，圣经应该从原来的语言翻译成各国通用的语言4。
question: Is the Word of God to be read by all?
answer: Although all are not to be permitted to read the word publicly to the congregation, yet all sorts of people are bound to read it apart by themselves, and with their families: to which end, the holy Scriptures are to be translated out of the original into vulgar languages.

notes_zh: 读经不仅是知识上的操练，更是心灵的敬拜。当以敬畏和渴慕的心来领受神的话语。
question_zh: 问157：应该怎样诵读圣经？
question_en: How is the Word of God to be read?
answer_en: The holy Scriptures are to be read with an high and reverent esteem of them; with a firm persuasion that they are the very Word of God, and that he only can enable us to understand them; with desire to know, believe, and obey the will of God revealed in them; with diligence, and attention to the matter and scope of them; with meditation, application, self-denial, and prayer.
answer_zh: 答：以极崇敬的态度诵读圣经1，（一）确信圣经就是神的话2，只有神能使我们明白圣经3；（二）热切认识、相信、顺服圣经所显明的神旨意4：（三）殷勤查考5，并且留意圣经的内容和范围6；（四）用默想7、实践8、舍己8、祷告9之态度读经。
question: How is the Word of God to be read?
answer: The holy Scriptures are to be read with an high and reverent esteem of them; with a firm persuasion that they are the very Word of God, and that he only can enable us to understand them; with desire to know, believe, and obey the will of God revealed in them; with diligence, and attention to the matter and scope of them; with meditation, application, self-denial, and prayer.

notes_zh: 讲道是受召并经教会认可之人的职分。这确保了圣道的忠实传讲和教会的良好秩序。
question_zh: 问158：谁可以讲道呢？
question_en: By whom is the Word of God to be preached?
answer_en: The Word of God is to be preached only by such as are sufficiently gifted, and also duly approved and called to that office.
answer_zh: 答：只有具备充分的恩赐1，并得到适当的认可，蒙召从事这一职分的人2，才能讲道。
question: By whom is the Word of God to be preached?
answer: The Word of God is to be preached only by such as are sufficiently gifted, and also duly approved and called to that office.

notes_zh: 传道人的使命不是表现自己，而是忠心传讲基督和祂的全备福音。讲道需要忠诚、智慧与火热的心。
question_zh: 问159：蒙召讲道的人应当如何讲道？
question_en: How is the Word of God to be preached by those that are called thereunto?
answer_en: They that are called to labor in the ministry of the word, are to preach sound doctrine, diligently, in season and out of season; plainly, not in the enticing words of man's wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit, and of power; faithfully, making known the whole counsel of God; wisely, applying themselves to the necessities and capacities of the hearers; zealously, with fervent love to God and the souls of his people; sincerely, aiming at his glory, and their conversion, edification, and salvation.
answer_zh: 答：蒙召讲道的人，是神圣言的工人，应当（一）传讲纯正的教义1，殷勤2，不论得时不得时3；（二）表达清楚4，不用人智慧委婉的言语，乃是用圣灵和大能的明证5，忠心6 把神各样的旨意传讲全备7；（三）有智慧8，全力配合会众的需要和度量9；（四）心里火热10，爱神11，爱神的子民12；诚诚实实13，使神得荣耀14，使神的百姓悔改归正15，得造就16，蒙救赎17。
question: How is the Word of God to be preached by those that are called thereunto?
answer: They that are called to labor in the ministry of the word, are to preach sound doctrine, diligently, in season and out of season; plainly, not in the enticing words of man's wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit, and of power; faithfully, making known the whole counsel of God; wisely, applying themselves to the necessities and capacities of the hearers; zealously, with fervent love to God and the souls of his people; sincerely, aiming at his glory, and their conversion, edification, and salvation.

notes_zh: 听道不是被动的消遣，而是需要预备心灵、专注聆听、并在生活中切实遵行。
question_zh: 问160：对听道的人有什么要求？
question_en: What is required of those that hear the word preached?
answer_en: It is required of those that hear the word preached, that they attend upon it with diligence, preparation, and prayer; examine what they hear by the Scriptures; receive the truth with faith, love, meekness, and readiness of mind, as the Word of God; meditate, and confer of it; hide it in their hearts, and bring forth the fruit of it in their lives.
answer_zh: 答：听道的人要（一）勤勉1、有预备2、有祷告3；（二）要用圣经考查听道的内容4；（三）以信心5、爱心6、谦卑的态度7，预备自己的心8，领受真理，认定这是神的话9；（四）默想10、谈论11、藏在心里12，并且在自己的生命中结出果子来13。
question: What is required of those that hear the word preached?
answer: It is required of those that hear the word preached, that they attend upon it with diligence, preparation, and prayer; examine what they hear by the Scriptures; receive the truth with faith, love, meekness, and readiness of mind, as the Word of God; meditate, and confer of it; hide it in their hearts, and bring forth the fruit of it in their lives.

notes_zh: 圣礼的功效不在于外在仪式本身，而在于圣灵借着圣礼在信徒心中的内在工作。
question_zh: 问161：圣礼怎样成为救赎的有效工具？
question_en: How do the sacraments become effectual means of salvation?
answer_en: The sacraments become effectual means of salvation, not by any power in themselves, or any virtue derived from the piety or intention of him by whom they are administered, but only by the working of the Holy Ghost, and the blessing of Christ, by whom they are instituted.
answer_zh: 答：圣礼成为救赎的有效工具，不是因为它本身有什么能力，也不是因为施行圣礼的人敬虔或意志使它有能力，而是单单因着圣灵的运行，和基督的祝福──设立圣礼的正是基督1。
question: How do the sacraments become effectual means of salvation?
answer: The sacraments become effectual means of salvation, not by any power in themselves, or any virtue derived from the piety or intention of him by whom they are administered, but only by the working of the Holy Ghost, and the blessing of Christ, by whom they are instituted.

notes_zh: 圣礼是可见的圣道，用有形的记号印证神无形的恩典，坚固信徒的信心。
question_zh: 问162：圣礼是什么？
question_en: What is a sacrament?
answer_en: A sacrament is an holy ordinance instituted by Christ in his church, to signify, seal, and exhibit unto those that are within the covenant of grace, the benefits of his mediation; to strengthen and increase their faith, and all other graces; to oblige them to obedience; to testify and cherish their love and communion one with another; and to distinguish them from those that are without.
answer_zh: 答：圣礼是基督在祂教会中设立的神圣约定1，向那恩典之约以下的人2 象征、引证、表明3 祂中保的恩惠4；坚固、增强他们的信心，和其他各样恩惠5；使他们有顺服的义务6；见证、分享他们彼此之间的爱心和交通7；并使他们与外人有分别8。
question: What is a sacrament?
answer: A sacrament is an holy ordinance instituted by Christ in his church, to signify, seal, and exhibit unto those that are within the covenant of grace, the benefits of his mediation; to strengthen and increase their faith, and all other graces; to oblige them to obedience; to testify and cherish their love and communion one with another; and to distinguish them from those that are without.

notes_zh: 圣礼将属灵的实际与物质的记号联系在一起，帮助我们凭信心把握神的应许。
question_zh: 问163：圣礼可以分成几个部分？
question_en: What are the parts of a sacrament?
answer_en: The parts of a sacrament are two; the one an outward and sensible sign, used according to Christ's own appointment; the other an inward and spiritual grace thereby signified.
answer_zh: 答：两个部分：（一）外在的可见记号，根据基督自己的吩咐而施行；（二）外在记号所象征的内在属灵恩典1。
question: What are the parts of a sacrament?
answer: The parts of a sacrament are two; the one an outward and sensible sign, used according to Christ's own appointment; the other an inward and spiritual grace thereby signified.

notes_zh: 基督只设立了洗礼和圣餐两个圣礼，作为祂教会经常性的蒙恩之道。
question_zh: 问164：在新约时代，基督在祂的教会中设立了多少圣礼？
question_en: How many sacraments hath Christ instituted in his church under the New Testament?
answer_en: Under the New Testament Christ hath instituted in his church only two sacraments, baptism and the Lord's supper.
answer_zh: 答：设立了两大圣礼：洗礼与圣餐1。
question: How many sacraments hath Christ instituted in his church under the New Testament?
answer: Under the New Testament Christ hath instituted in his church only two sacraments, baptism and the Lord's supper.

notes_zh: 洗礼不仅是外在的仪式，更是与基督联合、归入祂名下的记号和印证。
question_zh: 问165：洗礼是什么？
question_en: What is baptism?
answer_en: Baptism is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein Christ hath ordained the washing with water in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, to be a sign and seal of ingrafting into himself, of remission of sins by his blood, and regeneration by his Spirit; of adoption, and resurrection unto everlasting life; and whereby the parties baptized are solemnly admitted into the visible church, and enter into an open and professed engagement to be wholly and only the Lord's.
answer_zh: 答：是新约的圣礼。基督吩咐门徒奉父、子、圣灵的名为人用水施洗1，作为（一）与基督联合2、因祂宝血而罪得赦免3、因祂圣灵而重生4的标记与印证；（二）得儿子的名分5，复活得永生6 的标记与印证；（三）受洗者借此郑重归入有形教会7，公开认主，与主有约，全人归主，惟独属主8。
question: What is baptism?
answer: Baptism is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein Christ hath ordained the washing with water in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, to be a sign and seal of ingrafting into himself, of remission of sins by his blood, and regeneration by his Spirit; of adoption, and resurrection unto everlasting life; and whereby the parties baptized are solemnly admitted into the visible church, and enter into an open and professed engagement to be wholly and only the Lord's.

notes_zh: 洗礼是给信徒及其子女的，因为神恩典之约的应许延及信徒和他们的后裔。
question_zh: 问166：我们应该为谁施洗？
question_en: Unto whom is baptism to be administered?
answer_en: Baptism is not to be administered to any that are out of the visible church, and so strangers from the covenant of promise, till they profess their faith in Christ, and obedience to him, but infants descending from parents, either both, or but one of them, professing faith in Christ, and obedience to him, are in that respect within the covenant, and to be baptized.
answer_zh: 答：（一）如果有人在有形教会之外，在应许之约上是局外人，必须等他们公开承认归信基督，并顺服祂，才可为他们施洗1，（二）如果父母双方，或其中一方，已经公开承认归信基督，并顺服祂，那么他的婴孩也在恩典之约以下，可以为他洗2。
question: Unto whom is baptism to be administered?
answer: Baptism is not to be administered to any that are out of the visible church, and so strangers from the covenant of promise, till they profess their faith in Christ, and obedience to him, but infants descending from parents, either both, or but one of them, professing faith in Christ, and obedience to him, are in that respect within the covenant, and to be baptized.

notes_zh: 洗礼不是一次性的仪式，而是我们一生要回顾并活出来的——每日在基督里向罪死、向义活。
question_zh: 问167：我们可以怎样使我们的洗礼更真实有效？
question_en: How is baptism to be improved by us?
answer_en: The needful but much neglected duty of improving our baptism, is to be performed by us all our life long, especially in the time of temptation, and when we are present at the administration of it to others; by serious and thankful consideration of the nature of it, and of the ends for which Christ instituted it, the privileges and benefits conferred and sealed thereby, and our solemn vow made therein; by being humbled for our sinful defilement, our falling short of, and walking contrary to, the grace of baptism, and our engagements; by growing up to assurance of pardon of sin, and of all other blessings sealed to us in that sacrament; by drawing strength from the death and resurrection of Christ, into whom we are baptized, for the mortifying of sin, and quickening of grace; and by endeavoring to live by faith, to have our conversation in holiness and righteousness, as those that have therein given up their names to Christ; and to walk in brotherly love, as being baptized by the same Spirit into one body.
answer_zh: 答：我们有责任使我们的洗礼更真实有效，这是必要的，但也常被忽略。这是一辈子的事，但当我们受试探时，或参加别人洗礼时，尤其要留意1。使我们的洗礼更真实有效的方法有：（一）以感恩的心认真思考洗礼的本质、目的、带给我们的特别恩典和益处，和我们受洗时所发的庄重誓言2；（二）我们被罪玷污，亏欠洗礼之恩、背离我们在洗礼中所作的承诺，这些都使我们降卑3；（三）我们逐渐长大成熟，确信罪已经蒙赦免，并且确信洗礼所印证的各样福分4；（四）我们从基督的受死与复活中得力量。我们是受洗归入祂，使我们在罪上死，而神的恩典又使我们活过来5；（五）我们尽力凭信而活6，彼此以圣洁公义相交7，正如那在洗礼中把自己全人归给基督的人8；我们也彼此相爱如弟兄姊妹，因为我们由一位圣灵受洗，归入一个身体9。
question: How is baptism to be improved by us?
answer: The needful but much neglected duty of improving our baptism, is to be performed by us all our life long, especially in the time of temptation, and when we are present at the administration of it to others; by serious and thankful consideration of the nature of it, and of the ends for which Christ instituted it, the privileges and benefits conferred and sealed thereby, and our solemn vow made therein; by being humbled for our sinful defilement, our falling short of, and walking contrary to, the grace of baptism, and our engagements; by growing up to assurance of pardon of sin, and of all other blessings sealed to us in that sacrament; by drawing strength from the death and resurrection of Christ, into whom we are baptized, for the mortifying of sin, and quickening of grace; and by endeavoring to live by faith, to have our conversation in holiness and righteousness, as those that have therein given up their names to Christ; and to walk in brotherly love, as being baptized by the same Spirit into one body.

notes_zh: 圣餐是属灵的筵席，信徒凭信心真实地与基督相交，被祂的恩典所喂养和更新。
question_zh: 问168：圣餐是什么？
question_en: What is the Lord's supper?
answer_en: The Lord's supper is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein, by giving and receiving bread and wine according to the appointment of Jesus Christ, his death is showed forth; and they that worthily communicate feed upon his body and blood, to their spiritual nourishment and growth in grace; have their union and communion with him confirmed; testify and renew their thankfulness, and engagement to God, and their mutual love and fellowship each with other, as members of the same mystical body.
answer_zh: 答：圣餐是新约的圣礼1。我们按照耶稣基督指定的方式分饼喝杯，借着领圣餐表明祂的死。人如果配与基督相交，领圣餐就是吃主的肉，喝主的血；（一）得属灵的滋养，在恩典中长进2；（二）确认与基督联合、相交3；（三）见证他们对神心存感恩4、以身相许5；对弟兄有爱、彼此交接，同属基督奥秘身体6；并且经常保持这样的心态，历久弥新。
question: What is the Lord's supper?
answer: The Lord's supper is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein, by giving and receiving bread and wine according to the appointment of Jesus Christ, his death is showed forth; and they that worthily communicate feed upon his body and blood, to their spiritual nourishment and growth in grace; have their union and communion with him confirmed; testify and renew their thankfulness, and engagement to God, and their mutual love and fellowship each with other, as members of the same mystical body.

notes_zh: 圣餐的设立直接来自基督自己，在祂受难前夕赐给教会这宝贵的恩典记号。
question_zh: 问169：基督指定我们在圣餐中要怎样分饼喝杯？
question_en: How hath Christ appointed bread and wine to be given and received in the sacrament of the Lord's supper?
answer_en: Christ hath appointed the ministers of his word, in the administration of this sacrament of the Lord's supper, to set apart the bread and wine from common use, by the word of institution, thanksgiving, and prayer; to take and break the bread, and to give both the bread and the wine to the communicants: who are, by the same appointment, to take and eat the bread, and to drink the wine, in thankful remembrance that the body of Christ was broken and given, and his blood shed, for them.
answer_zh: 答：（一）服事祂话语的传道人，要在圣餐中宣读基督设立圣餐的话，并且感恩、祷告，借此将饼杯分别出来；（二）拿起饼来，擘开，把饼杯分给受餐教友（communicant）；（三）受餐教友也同样按照基督的吩咐，拿起饼来吃、拿起杯来喝，以感恩的心记念基督的身体为他们而舍，基督的宝血为他们而流1。
question: How hath Christ appointed bread and wine to be given and received in the sacrament of the Lord's supper?
answer: Christ hath appointed the ministers of his word, in the administration of this sacrament of the Lord's supper, to set apart the bread and wine from common use, by the word of institution, thanksgiving, and prayer; to take and break the bread, and to give both the bread and the wine to the communicants: who are, by the same appointment, to take and eat the bread, and to drink the wine, in thankful remembrance that the body of Christ was broken and given, and his blood shed, for them.

notes_zh: 圣餐中的领受是真实的属灵相交，虽然不是肉体的吃喝，却是凭信心真实地领受基督的恩典。
question_zh: 问170：配领圣餐的人怎样在圣餐中吃基督的身体与血？
question_en: How do they that worthily communicate in the Lord's supper feed upon the body and blood of Christ therein?
answer_en: As the body and blood of Christ are not corporally or carnally present in, with, or under the bread and wine in the Lord's supper, and yet are spiritually present to the faith of the receiver, no less truly and really than the elements themselves are to their outward senses; so they that worthily communicate in the sacrament of the Lord's supper, do therein feed upon the body and blood of Christ, not after a corporal and carnal, but in a spiritual manner; yet truly and really, while by faith they receive and apply unto themselves Christ crucified, and all the benefits of his death.
answer_zh: 答：（一）基督的身体与血并不以物质的形式，也不以肉体的形式出现在饼杯之中，也不与饼杯同在，也不在饼杯之下1，而以属灵的形式，按照领受者的信心临在。（二）这种属灵临在的真实性，不下于领受者用外在器官感受饼杯的真实性2；所以，那些配领受圣餐的人，确实在圣餐中吃喝基督的身体与血，但不是以物质或肉体的方式吃，而是以属灵的方式吃；（三）虽然这样，他们仍真实3领受钉十架的基督，和受死带来的一切恩惠，并且应用在自己身上4。
question: How do they that worthily communicate in the Lord's supper feed upon the body and blood of Christ therein?
answer: As the body and blood of Christ are not corporally or carnally present in, with, or under the bread and wine in the Lord's supper, and yet are spiritually present to the faith of the receiver, no less truly and really than the elements themselves are to their outward senses; so they that worthily communicate in the sacrament of the Lord's supper, do therein feed upon the body and blood of Christ, not after a corporal and carnal, but in a spiritual manner; yet truly and really, while by faith they receive and apply unto themselves Christ crucified, and all the benefits of his death.

notes_zh: 领圣餐前的自省是严肃的属灵操练，帮助我们以敬虔、感恩的心来到主的桌前。
question_zh: 问171：在领受圣餐之前，领受者应当怎样预备自己？
question_en: How are they that receive the sacrament of the Lord's supper to prepare themselves before they come unto it?
answer_en: They that receive the sacrament of the Lord's supper are, before they come, to prepare themselves thereunto, by examining themselves of their being in Christ, of their sins and wants; of the truth and measure of their knowledge, faith, repentance; love to God and the brethren, charity to all men, forgiving those that have done them wrong; of their desires after Christ, and of their new obedience; and by renewing the exercise of these graces, by serious meditation, and fervent prayer.
answer_zh: 答：（一）省察自己1是否有基督在心里2；（二）省察自己的罪和亏欠3；（三）省察自己的知识4、信心5和悔改6是否正确、深入；（四）省察自己对神、对弟兄7、对众人的爱8，是否饶恕了那些得罪自己的人9；（五）省察自己是否渴慕基督10，在顺服上有进步11；（六）重新操练这些恩典12，认真默想13，恒切祷告14。

question_zh: 问172：一个人如果怀疑自己不在基督里，或者怀疑自己没有作好应有的预备，那么他还可以领受圣餐吗？
question_en: May one who doubteth of his being in Christ, or of his due preparation, come to the Lord's supper?
answer_en: One who doubteth of his being in Christ, or of his due preparation to the sacrament of the Lord's supper, may have true interest in Christ, though he be not yet assured thereof; and in God's account hath it, if he be duly affected with the apprehension of the want of it, and unfeignedly desires to be found in Christ, and to depart from iniquity: in which case (because promises are made, and this sacrament is appointed, for the relief even of weak and doubting Christians) he is to bewail his unbelief, and labor to have his doubts resolved; and, so doing, he may and ought to come to the Lord's supper, that he may be further strengthened.
answer_zh: 答：如果一个人怀疑自己不在基督里，或怀疑自己没有预备好领受圣餐，其实也许还是与基督有分，只是没有确据罢了1。如果他们真是因为知道自己没有预备好而这样想2，又确实渴慕自己是在基督里3，并愿意脱离罪恶4，神就还是算他有分。在这种情况下，他要为自己的不信悲伤5，努力消除自己的怀疑6（因为神有这个应许，设立这个圣礼，也是让软弱多疑的基督徒释怀7）。然后他可以、也应当参加圣餐，使自己得坚固8。

question_zh: 问173：有没有人即使称自己是基督徒，想领圣餐，教会仍可以禁止？
question_en: May any who profess the faith, and desire to come to the Lord's supper, be kept from it?
answer_en: Such as are found to be ignorant or scandalous, notwithstanding their profession of the faith, and desire to come to the Lord's supper, may and ought to be kept from that sacrament, by the power which Christ hath left in his church, until they receive instruction, and manifest their reformation.
answer_zh: 答：如果有人言行愚昧无知，触犯道德，那么尽管他们称自己是基督徒，想领圣餐，教会按照基督所赐的权柄，仍然可以禁止，也应该禁止他们领圣餐1。他们必须接受训诲，有改过自新的具体表现，才可以领圣餐2。

question_zh: 问174：领圣餐时，领受的人要怎样行？
question_en: What is required of them that receive the sacrament of the Lord's supper in the time of the administration of it?
answer_en: It is required of them that receive the sacrament of the Lord's supper, that, during the time of the administration of it, with all holy reverence and attention they wait upon God in that ordinance, diligently observe the sacramental elements and actions, heedfully discern the Lord's body, and affectionately meditate on his death and sufferings, and thereby stir up themselves to a vigorous exercise of their graces; in judging themselves, and sorrowing for sin; in earnest hungering and thirsting after Christ, feeding on him by faith, receiving of his fullness, trusting in his merits, rejoicing in his love, giving thanks for his grace; in renewing of their covenant with God, and love to all the saints.
answer_zh: 答：（一）要全心敬畏，圣洁虔诚，集中心力，按规矩等候神1，殷勤注视每个细节与动作2，仔细分辨主的身体3，默想基督的受死和受苦，充满感情4，借此激励自己实行神的恩典，蓬勃奋发5；（二）分辨自己6，为罪忧伤7；切切渴慕基督8，借着信心以祂为粮9，领受祂的丰盛10，信靠祂救赎的工作11，在祂的大爱中欢喜12，感谢祂的恩典13；（三）思想起初与神立约的誓愿14、与众圣徒相交的爱心15。

question_zh: 问175：基督徒领圣餐后，有责任做什么事？
question_en: What is the duty of Christians, after they have received the sacrament of the Lord's supper?
answer_en: The duty of Christians, after they have received the sacrament of the Lord's supper, is seriously to consider how they have behaved themselves therein, and with what success; if they find quickening and comfort, to bless God for it, beg the continuance of it, watch against relapses, fulfill their vows, and encourage themselves to a frequent attendance on that ordinance: but if they find no present benefit, more exactly to review their preparation to, and carriage at, the sacrament; in both which, if they can approve themselves to God and their own consciences, they are to wait for the fruit of it in due time: but, if they see they have failed in either, they are to be humbled, and to attend upon it afterwards with more care and diligence.
answer_zh: 答：（一）认真思想自己领圣餐时的行为举止，和它们的果效1；（二）如果有得到鼓励和安慰的地方，就要为此称颂神2，恳求神继续施恩3，保持儆醒，免得退步4，完成自己所许的愿5，勉励自己常常参加圣餐6；（三）如果发现没有得到什么恩惠，就要更加仔细省察自己对圣餐的预备，和参加圣餐时的行为举止7；（四）无论是哪一种情况，如果他们对得起神，也对得起自己的良心，就应该等时候到了，得着果子8；（五）但是如果对神、或对自己的良心有亏欠，就要谦卑9，下次领圣餐时更慎重、更殷勤10。

question_zh: 问176：洗礼和圣餐有什么共同的地方？
question_en: Wherein do the sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper agree?
answer_en: The sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper agree, in that the author of both is God; the spiritual part of both is Christ and his benefits; both are seals of the same covenant, are to be dispensed by ministers of the gospel, and by none other; and to be continued in the church of Christ until his second coming.
answer_zh: 答：（一）都是由神设立的1；（二）从属灵的角度而言，都是基督和祂的恩惠2；（三）都是同一个恩典之约的标记3；（四）都要由神所差遣设立的传道人施行，其他任何人都不得施行4；（五）都要在教会中一直延续下去，直到祂再临5。

question_zh: 问177：洗礼和圣餐有哪些不同的地方？
question_en: Wherein do the sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper differ?
answer_en: The sacraments of baptism and the Lord's supper differ, in that baptism is to be administered but once, with water, to be a sign and seal of our regeneration and ingrafting into Christ, and that even to infants; whereas the Lord's supper is to be administered often, in the elements of bread and wine, to represent and exhibit Christ as spiritual nourishment to the soul, and to confirm our continuance and growth in him, and that only to such as are of years and ability to examine themselves.
answer_zh: 答：（一）基督徒一生只受洗一次，用水施洗作为我们重生和与基督联合的标记和印证1。教会也应当为婴儿施洗2；（二）基督徒经常领圣餐，用饼与杯代表并显明基督餵养我们的灵魂3，确认我们一直在祂里面成长4。一个人必须长大到能省察自己的年龄，才能领圣餐5。

question_zh: 问178：祷告是什么？
question_en: What is prayer?
answer_en: Prayer is an offering up of our desires unto God, in the name of Christ, by the help of his Spirit; with confession of our sins, and thankful acknowledgement of his mercies.
answer_zh: 答：祷告就是奉基督的名1，借着圣灵的帮助2，向神陈明我们的愿望3；承认我们的罪4，并以感恩的心承认祂的恩慈5。

notes_zh: 祷告是对神主权和能力的承认。唯有三一真神是祷告的对象，不可向圣徒、天使或任何受造物祷告。
question_zh: 问179：我们只当向神祷告吗？
question_en: Are we to pray unto God only?
answer_en: God only being able to search the hearts, hear the requests, pardon the sins, and fulfill the desires of all; and only to be believed in, and worshiped with religious worship; prayer, which is a special part thereof, is to be made by all to him alone, and to none other.
answer_zh: 答：是的；只有神鉴察人心1，垂听呼求2，赦免诸罪3，并满足众人各样的心愿4。也只有神才是信靠的对象5，只有祂能被人用宗教方式加以敬拜6。祷告既然也是一种敬拜7，所以我们只能向祂祷告8，不能向其他任何对象祷告9。

question_zh: 问180：「奉基督的名祷告」是什么意思？
question_en: What is it to pray in the name of Christ?
answer_en: To pray in the name of Christ is, in obedience to his command, and in confidence on his promises, to ask mercy for his sake; not by bare mentioning of his name, but by drawing our encouragement to pray, and our boldness, strength, and hope of acceptance in prayer, from Christ and his mediation.
answer_zh: 答：顺服祂的诫命，确信祂的应许，求神为祂的缘故怜悯我们1；不是单单提祂的名字而已2，而是从基督和祂的中保职分中得着鼓励、勇气、力量，和蒙悦纳的盼望，所以祷告3。

question_zh: 问181：为什么我们要奉基督的名祷告？
question_en: Why are we to pray in the name of Christ?
answer_en: The sinfulness of man, and his distance from God by reason thereof, being so great, as that we can have no access into his presence without a mediator; and there being none in heaven or earth appointed to, or fit for, that glorious work but Christ alone, we are to pray in no other name but his only.
answer_zh: 答：人的罪性这么大，以致人与神如此疏离，如果不借助一位中保，我们无法来到神的面前1；除了基督之外，天上地下没有谁被指派担任这荣耀的工作，也没有谁适合这工作2。所以我们不要奉任何其他的名字祷告，而只要奉祂的名字祷告3。

question_zh: 问182：圣灵怎样帮助我们祷告？
question_en: How doth the Spirit help us to pray?
answer_en: We not knowing what to pray for as we ought, the Spirit helpeth our infirmities, by enabling us to understand both for whom, and what, and how prayer is to be made; and by working and quickening in our hearts (although not in all persons, nor at all times, in the same measure) those apprehensions, affections, and graces which are requisite for the right performance of that duty.
answer_zh: 答：我们本不晓得当怎样祷告，圣灵帮助我们的软弱，使我们能够明白为谁祷告，祷告什么，如何祷告；祂又在我们的心中动工，感动我们（虽然并不是在每个人心中，也不是在每个时刻，也不是以同样的程度），使我们有必要的悟性、感情和恩典，能完成这祷告的责任1。

question_zh: 问183：我们应该为谁祷告？
question_en: For whom are we to pray?
answer_en: We are to pray for the whole church of Christ upon earth; for magistrates, and ministers; for ourselves, our brethren, yea, our enemies; and for all sorts of men living, or that shall live hereafter; but not for the dead, nor for those that are known to have sinned the sin unto death.
answer_zh: 答：我们应该为基督在地上的整个教会祷告1，为政府官长2、传道人3、我们自己4、我们的弟兄5、我们的敌人6、各种活着的人7，和将要来到这个世界的人8祷告。但我们不要为死人祷告9，也不要为那些已经知道犯了至于死的罪的人祷告10。

question_zh: 问184：我们应该为什么事祷告？
question_en: For what things are we to pray?
answer_en: We are to pray for all things tending to the glory of God, the welfare of the church, our own or others' good; but not for anything that is unlawful.
answer_zh: 答：我们应该为一切使神得荣耀1、教会得益处2、我们自己3或别人4得益处的事祷告；但不应该为不法的事祷告5。

question_zh: 问185：我们应该怎样祷告？
question_en: How are we to pray?
answer_en: We are to pray with an awful apprehension of the majesty of God, and deep sense of our own unworthiness, necessities, and sins; with penitent, thankful, and enlarged hearts; with understanding, faith, sincerity, fervency, love, and perseverance, waiting upon him, with humble submission to his will.
answer_zh: 答：（一）存敬畏的心体会神的威严1，深知自己不配2，也深知自己的需要3和罪过4；（二）以悔改5、感恩6、宽广的心7祷告；（三）以悟性8和信心9祷告，真诚10，恳切11，有爱心12，有恒心13，等候神14，并且谦卑降服在祂旨意之下15。

question_zh: 问186：神赐给我们什么准则，让我们在尽祷告责任时可以遵循？
question_en: What rule hath God given for our direction in the duty of prayer?
answer_en: The whole Word of God is of use to direct us in the duty of prayer; but the special rule of direction is that form of prayer which our Savior Christ taught his disciples, commonly called The Lord's prayer.
answer_zh: 答：神所有的圣言都是用来指导我们如何尽祷告的责任1；至于特别的指导准则，则是我们救主基督教导门徒祷告时所用的祷告方式，也就是通称的主祷文2。

question_zh: 问187：我们应该怎样使用主祷文？
question_en: How is the Lord's prayer to be used?
answer_en: The Lord's prayer is not only for direction, as a pattern, according to which we are to make other prayers; but may also be used as a prayer, so that it be done with understanding, faith, reverence, and other graces necessary to the right performance of the duty of prayer.
answer_zh: 答：主祷文不仅是一个祷告模式，可以指导我们依循这模式作各种祷告；它本身也可以作为一个祷告。我们要用正确祷告所需的各样恩典，例如悟性、信心、敬畏等，来这样祷告1。

question_zh: 问188：主祷文分几个部分？
question_en: Of how many parts doth the Lord's prayer consist?
answer_en: The Lord's prayer consists of three parts; a preface, petitions, and a conclusion.
