question: Of how many parts doth the Lord's prayer consist?
answer: The Lord's prayer consists of three parts; a preface, petitions, and a conclusion.

notes_zh: 这个祈求提醒我们在日常生活中倚靠神的供应，每一天的需要都仰望祂的恩典。
question_zh: 问189：主祷文的序言教导我们什么？
question_en: What doth the preface of the Lord's prayer teach us?
answer_en: The preface of the Lord's prayer (contained in these words, Our Father which art in heaven ) teacheth us, when we pray, to draw near to God with confidence of his fatherly goodness, and our interest therein; with reverence, and all other childlike dispositions, heavenly affections, and due apprehensions of his sovereign power, majesty, and gracious condescension: as also, to pray with and for others.
answer_zh: 答：主祷文的序言「我们在天上的父」1教导我们祷告的时候：（一）要就近神，确信祂像父亲一样慈爱，而且我们的好处不在祂以外2；（二）要有敬畏的心，和其他像孩子般的性情3、属天情感4，对祂主权、威严和恩典的临在有适当的认识5；（三）和别人一起祷告，并且为别人祷告6。
question: What doth the preface of the Lord's prayer teach us?
answer: The preface of the Lord's prayer (contained in these words, Our Father which art in heaven) teacheth us, when we pray, to draw near to God with confidence of his fatherly goodness, and our interest therein; with reverence, and all other childlike dispositions, heavenly affections, and due apprehensions of his sovereign power, majesty, and gracious condescension: as also, to pray with and for others.

notes_zh: 我们求神赦免我们的罪，也因蒙赦免的恩典而甘心饶恕他人——这两者不可分割。
question_zh: 问190：我们在第一项祈求中祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the first petition?
answer_en: In the first petition (which is, Hallowed be thy name ), acknowledging the utter inability and indisposition that is in ourselves and all men to honor God aright, we pray, that God would by his grace enable and incline us and others to know, to acknowledge, and highly to esteem him, his titles, attributes, ordinances, word, works, and whatsoever he is pleased to make himself known by; and to glorify him in thought, word, and deed: that he would prevent and remove atheism, ignorance, idolatry, profaneness, and whatsoever is dishonorable to him; and, by his overruling providence, direct and dispose of all things to his own glory.
answer_zh: 答：第一项祈求是「愿人都尊你的名为圣」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认我们自己和其他每个人，完全不能、也不愿意2正确地荣耀神，因此我们祈求神借着祂的恩典，使我们和别人都能够、也都愿意晓得、承认并极度尊崇祂3、祂的名号4、属性5、典章、话语6、作为，和一切祂乐意用来显明自己的事物7；（二）在心思、言语8，和行为9上荣耀祂；求祂拦阻、消除无神论10、无知11、偶像崇拜12、亵渎13，以及一切不荣耀祂的事14；并且求祂借着祂统管万有的护理，引导并安排万事，使祂自己得荣耀15。
question: What do we pray for in the first petition?
answer: In the first petition (which is, Hallowed be thy name), acknowledging the utter inability and indisposition that is in ourselves and all men to honor God aright, we pray, that God would by his grace enable and incline us and others to know, to acknowledge, and highly to esteem him, his titles, attributes, ordinances, word, works, and whatsoever he is pleased to make himself known by; and to glorify him in thought, word, and deed: that he would prevent and remove atheism, ignorance, idolatry, profaneness, and whatsoever is dishonorable to him; and, by his overruling providence, direct and dispose of all things to his own glory.

notes_zh: 我们的软弱需要神的保守。这个祈求承认我们无力自保，唯靠神的大能胜过试探。
question_zh: 问191：我们在第二项祈求中祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the second petition?
answer_en: In the second petition (which is, Thy kingdom come ), acknowledging ourselves and all mankind to be by nature under the dominion of sin and Satan, we pray, that the kingdom of sin and Satan may be destroyed, the gospel propagated throughout the world, the Jews called, the fullness of the Gentiles brought in; the church furnished with all gospel officers and ordinances, purged from corruption, countenanced and maintained by the civil magistrate; that the ordinances of Christ may be purely dispensed, and made effectual to the converting of those that are yet in their sins, and the confirming, comforting, and building up of those that are already converted: that Christ would rule in our hearts here, and hasten the time of his second coming, and our reigning with him forever: and that he would be pleased so to exercise the kingdom of his power in all the world, as may best conduce to these ends.
answer_zh: 答：第二项祈求是「愿你的国降临」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认我们自己和全人类生来在罪恶和撒但的辖制下2；（二）求神毁灭罪恶的撒但国度3，使福音在全世界广传4，呼召犹太人5，使外邦人的日期满足6；（三）教会有各样的福音工人和典章7，清除一切败坏8，得到政府的支持和保护9：使基督的律法得以纯正地执行，有效地使那些仍在罪中的人悔改归正，使那些已经悔改归正的人得坚固、安慰和建造10；（四）使基督此时此地就在我们心中掌权11，使祂快快再来，我们与祂一同作王，直到永永远远12；（五）祂按自己的美意在世上行使祂的权柄，尽善尽美地成就这些事13。
question: What do we pray for in the second petition?
answer: In the second petition (which is, Thy kingdom come), acknowledging ourselves and all mankind to be by nature under the dominion of sin and Satan, we pray, that the kingdom of sin and Satan may be destroyed, the gospel propagated throughout the world, the Jews called, the fullness of the Gentiles brought in; the church furnished with all gospel officers and ordinances, purged from corruption, countenanced and maintained by the civil magistrate; that the ordinances of Christ may be purely dispensed, and made effectual to the converting of those that are yet in their sins, and the confirming, comforting, and building up of those that are already converted: that Christ would rule in our hearts here, and hasten the time of his second coming, and our reigning with him forever: and that he would be pleased so to exercise the kingdom of his power in all the world, as may best conduce to these ends.

notes_zh: 祷告以赞美结束，宣告一切权柄和荣耀都归于神。'阿们'是信心的宣告——求必蒙应允。
question_zh: 问192：在第三项祈求中，我们祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the third petition?
answer_en: In the third petition (which is, Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven ), acknowledging that by nature we and all men are not only utterly unable and unwilling to know and to do the will of God, but prone to rebel against his word, to repine and murmur against his providence, and wholly inclined to do the will of the flesh, and of the devil: we pray, that God would by his Spirit take away from ourselves and others all blindness, weakness, indisposedness, and perverseness of heart; and by his grace make us able and willing to know, do, and submit to his will in all things, with the like humility, cheerfulness, faithfulness, diligence, zeal, sincerity, and constancy, as the angels do in heaven.
answer_zh: 答：第三项祈求是「愿你的旨意行在地上，如同行在天上」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认我们和全人类不但生来完全不能、也不愿意认识并遵行神的旨意2，而且倾向于悖逆祂的圣言3，对神的护理牢骚满腹4，一心要成就肉体和魔鬼的旨意5，所以我们求神借着祂的圣灵，消除我们自己和别人的一切盲目6、软弱7、不情愿8，和心灵的悖逆9；（二）祈求神借着祂的恩典，使我们能够，并且愿意在一切的事上认识、遵行、顺服神的旨意10，像天上的天使一样11，谦卑12、喜乐13、诚实14、勤勉15、热情16、认真17、持久18。
question: What do we pray for in the third petition?
answer: In the third petition (which is, Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven), acknowledging that by nature we and all men are not only utterly unable and unwilling to know and to do the will of God, but prone to rebel against his word, to repine and murmur against his providence, and wholly inclined to do the will of the flesh, and of the devil: we pray, that God would by his Spirit take away from ourselves and others all blindness, weakness, indisposedness, and perverseness of heart; and by his grace make us able and willing to know, do, and submit to his will in all things, with the like humility, cheerfulness, faithfulness, diligence, zeal, sincerity, and constancy, as the angels do in heaven.

notes_zh: 基督徒的祷告应当广泛，包括教会、掌权者和所有在世的人，但不包括已死之人。
question_zh: 问193：在第四项祈求中，我们祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
answer_en: In the fourth petition (which is, Give us this day our daily bread ), acknowledging that in Adam, and by our own sin, we have forfeited our right to all the outward blessings of this life, and deserve to be wholly deprived of them by God, and to have them cursed to us in the use of them; and that neither they of themselves are able to sustain us, nor we to merit, or by our own industry to procure them; but prone to desire, get, and use them unlawfully: we pray for ourselves and others, that both they and we, waiting upon the providence of God from day to day in the use of lawful means, may, of his free gift, and as to his fatherly wisdom shall seem best, enjoy a competent portion of them; and have the same continued and blessed unto us in our holy and comfortable use of them, and contentment in them; and be kept from all things that are contrary to our temporal support and comfort.
answer_zh: 答：第四项祈求是「我们日用的饮食，今日赐给我们」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认我们在亚当里因为自己的罪，丧失了享用今生一切外在福分的权利，本来应该被神完全收回；（二）当我们享用这些外在福分时，它们都已经被咒诅2；本身并不能维系我们的生命3，我们无功劳可居4，也无法靠我们自己的辛劳取得它们5；但我们都倾向于非法追求6、获取7、享用这些福分8；（三）因此我们为我们自己和别人祷告，求神使他们和我们等候神的护理，天天用合法的手段，靠祂白白的恩赐，承认祂是我们的天父，按祂的智慧看为最合适的，享受足够的部分9；（四）求神继续祝福我们，使我们得以圣洁、舒适地享用这些福分10，并有知足之心11；也求神使我们离开一切不利于今生养身和舒适的事物12。
question: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
answer: In the fourth petition (which is, Give us this day our daily bread), acknowledging that in Adam, and by our own sin, we have forfeited our right to all the outward blessings of this life, and deserve to be wholly deprived of them by God, and to have them cursed to us in the use of them; and that neither they of themselves are able to sustain us, nor we to merit, or by our own industry to procure them; but prone to desire, get, and use them unlawfully: we pray for ourselves and others, that both they and we, waiting upon the providence of God from day to day in the use of lawful means, may, of his free gift, and as to his fatherly wisdom shall seem best, enjoy a competent portion of them; and have the same continued and blessed unto us in our holy and comfortable use of them, and contentment in them; and be kept from all things that are contrary to our temporal support and comfort.

notes_zh: 歌唱赞美是敬拜不可或缺的部分，是用心灵诚实来荣耀神的美好方式。
question_zh: 问194：在第五项祈求中，我们祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
answer_en: In the fifth petition (which is, Forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors ), acknowledging that we and all others are guilty both of original and actual sin, and thereby become debtors to the justice of God; and that neither we, nor any other creature, can make the least satisfaction for that debt: we pray for ourselves and others, that God of his free grace would, through the obedience and satisfaction of Christ, apprehended and applied by faith, acquit us both from the guilt and punishment of sin, accept us in his Beloved; continue his favor and grace to us, pardon our daily failings, and fill us with peace and joy, in giving us daily more and more assurance of forgiveness; which we are the rather emboldened to ask, and encouraged to expect, when we have this testimony in ourselves, that we from the heart forgive others their offenses.
answer_zh: 答：第五项祈求是「免我们的债，如同我们免了人的债」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认我们和全人类都有原罪和本罪（actual sin），因此亏欠神的公义，而且不管是我们自己，还是其他任何受造物，都丝毫不能代偿这债2；（二）因此我们为我们自己和别人祷告，祈求神以祂白白的恩典，借着基督的顺服和补赎（satisfication），免除罪给我们带来的罪咎和惩罚，我们也用信心领悟并支取这恩典3，祂便在祂的爱子里接纳我们4；（三）我们也祈求神继续恩待我们5，饶恕我们每天的失败6，用平安和喜乐充满我们，天天赐给我们更大的确据，使我们知道罪得赦免7；（四）圣经鼓励我们这样祈求，如此期望。当我们内心拥有这种印证时，我们就会从心里饶恕别人的过犯8。
question: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
answer: In the fifth petition (which is, Forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors), acknowledging that we and all others are guilty both of original and actual sin, and thereby become debtors to the justice of God; and that neither we, nor any other creature, can make the least satisfaction for that debt: we pray for ourselves and others, that God of his free grace would, through the obedience and satisfaction of Christ, apprehended and applied by faith, acquit us both from the guilt and punishment of sin, accept us in his Beloved; continue his favor and grace to us, pardon our daily failings, and fill us with peace and joy, in giving us daily more and more assurance of forgiveness; which we are the rather emboldened to ask, and encouraged to expect, when we have this testimony in ourselves, that we from the heart forgive others their offenses.

notes_zh: 此祈求重申我们全然倚靠神保守的必要。在属灵争战中，唯有神的恩典使我们得以站立。
question_zh: 问195：在第六项祈求中，我们祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
answer_en: In the sixth petition (which is, And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil ), acknowledging that the most wise, righteous, and gracious God, for divers holy and just ends, may so order things, that we may be assaulted, foiled, and for a time led captive by temptations; that Satan, the world, and the flesh, are ready powerfully to draw us aside, and ensnare us; and that we, even after the pardon of our sins, by reason of our corruption, weakness, and want of watchfulness, are not only subject to be tempted, and forward to expose ourselves unto temptations, but also of ourselves unable and unwilling to resist them, to recover out of them, and to improve them; and worthy to be left under the power of them; we pray, that God would so overrule the world and all in it, subdue the flesh, and restrain Satan, order all things, bestow and bless all means of grace, and quicken us to watchfulness in the use of them, that we and all his people may by his providence be kept from being tempted to sin; or, if tempted, that by his Spirit we may be powerfully supported and enabled to stand in the hour of temptation; or when fallen, raised again and recovered out of it, and have a sanctified use and improvement thereof: that our sanctification and salvation may be perfected, Satan trodden under our feet, and we fully freed from sin, temptation, and all evil, forever.
answer_zh: 答：第六项祈求是「不叫我们遇见试探，救我们脱离凶恶」1，我们在此祷告：（一）承认至智、至义、至慈的神，为了各种圣洁与公义的目的，或许吩咐万有，让我们受打击、遭挫折，一时陷于试探之中2；撒但3、世界4和肉体，则时刻准备用力把我们拉到一边，陷害我们5；（二）即使在我们罪得赦免之后，由于我们自己的败坏6、软弱、不够儆醒7，不仅易受试探，动辄就把自己暴露于试探之下8，而且我们自身没有能力，也不愿意抵挡试探，脱离试探，胜过试探9；因此该被神弃绝，使我们在试探的权势之下10。（三）所以我们祷告，祈求神制伏世界和其中的一切11，制伏肉体12，抑制撒但13，统管万有14，赐下并祝福各样蒙恩的管道15，激励我们儆醒善用，使我们和祂一切的子民，借着祂的护理蒙保守，不致受试探犯罪16；（四）我们即使受到试探，也求主借着祂的圣灵使我们得到有力的扶持，能够在受试探的时候站立得稳17；即或我们跌倒，也能再起，恢复过来18，并且用圣洁的方式使这试探为我们效力，使我们胜过试探19，也使我们的成圣和救赎得以完全20，使撒但被践踏在我们的脚下21，使我们完全从罪、试探及一切的邪恶中得释放，直到永远22。
question: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
answer: In the sixth petition (which is, And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil), acknowledging that the most wise, righteous, and gracious God, for divers holy and just ends, may so order things, that we may be assaulted, foiled, and for a time led captive by temptations; that Satan, the world, and the flesh, are ready powerfully to draw us aside, and ensnare us; and that we, even after the pardon of our sins, by reason of our corruption, weakness, and want of watchfulness, are not only subject to be tempted, and forward to expose ourselves unto temptations, but also of ourselves unable and unwilling to resist them, to recover out of them, and to improve them; and worthy to be left under the power of them; we pray, that God would so overrule the world and all in it, subdue the flesh, and restrain Satan, order all things, bestow and bless all means of grace, and quicken us to watchfulness in the use of them, that we and all his people may by his providence be kept from being tempted to sin; or, if tempted, that by his Spirit we may be powerfully supported and enabled to stand in the hour of temptation; or when fallen, raised again and recovered out of it, and have a sanctified use and improvement thereof: that our sanctification and salvation may be perfected, Satan trodden under our feet, and we fully freed from sin, temptation, and all evil, forever.

notes_zh: 整部要理问答以祷告和赞美作结，提醒我们基督徒的生命是以荣耀神为始终的。阿们。
question_zh: 问196：主祷文的结语教导我们什么？
question_en: What doth the conclusion of the Lord's prayer teach us?
answer_en: The conclusion of the Lord's prayer (which is, For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen. ) teacheth us to enforce our petitions with arguments, which are to be taken, not from any worthiness in ourselves, or in any other creature, but from God; and with our prayers to join praises, ascribing to God alone eternal sovereignty, omnipotency, and glorious excellency; in regard whereof, as he is able and willing to help us, so we by faith are emboldened to plead with him that he would, and quietly to rely upon him, that he will fulfill our requests. And, to testify this our desire and assurance, we say, Amen.
answer_zh: 答：主祷文的结语是「因为国度，权柄，荣耀，全是你的，直到永远」1，教导我们：（一）要用论理的方式加强我们的祈求2，这不是因为我们自己有什么道理配拿来辩论，也不是因为其他任何受造物，而是出于神3；（二）在祷告中要讚美神4，把永恒的主权、全能，与荣耀的尊称单单归于祂5；因为祂能够、也愿意帮助我们6，所以我们要借着信心，坦然无惧地向祂祈求7，安静依靠祂，相信祂会成全我们的祈求8。（三）为了表明这是我们的心愿，也是我们的确信，所以我们说「阿们」9。
question: What doth the conclusion of the Lord's prayer teach us?
answer: The conclusion of the Lord's prayer (which is, For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.) teacheth us to enforce our petitions with arguments, which are to be taken, not from any worthiness in ourselves, or in any other creature, but from God; and with our prayers to join praises, ascribing to God alone eternal sovereignty, omnipotency, and glorious excellency; in regard whereof, as he is able and willing to help us, so we by faith are emboldened to plead with him that he would, and quietly to rely upon him, that he will fulfill our requests.
